story:
Update: You can get your own Socibot Mini as part of our corporate sponsor package, or (for much less), have your face and voice embodied on a social robot. See below for details, or watch our latest youtube here: Socibot-Mini Explains It All

Synopsis

"Sally's confused. She's mislaid her husband. But there's a robot in her living room and his voice is familiar."

A confused elderly lady and a humanoid robot sing a fractured duet. Out of this unfolds a human love story - the ultimate odd-couple romance. 

In response to his wife's Alzheimer's diagnosis, an ailing obsessive archivist builds a perfected robotic version of himself, to be deployed after his death: a patient carer, an aide-memoir, a singing partner, able to give order to her confusion, and to bear without complaint the endless repetition required to reassure her.

As her mind deteriorates, their exchanges acquire an odd poetry, a secret language expressed as a duet. And, on some level, their love survives.

The idea


Spillikin is a play about the near future, about memory, about humanity itself. It is also a deeply personal work, drawing on the experiences of the Pipeline team and of Alzheimer's carers and support networks around the country.  The themes also resonate on a societal level, as we confront the reality of an ageing population and turn to technology for support. The robot in Spillikin may seem a long way in in the future, but in fact we took only a few leaps to get there from the extant present.



Why do we need you? 

Pipeline Theatre will be at the Pleasance Theatre venue in the Edinburgh Fringe, and Latitude Festival. We have  been given Arts Council and some locally sourced r&d funding to write, build and create the show. What we need  is the money to get there, so we can pay our actors and director properly, rehearse things thoroughly, and put on the highest quality production possible.

To do this, we're looking for help from you guys. But we also want to give you something in return! With the help of our partners and robot sponsors Engineered Arts Ltd, we've conspired to assemble a set of unique, futuristic, un-buyable rewards and experiences for anyone who backs us.


Expenses and costs

for 3 days at the Latitude Festival and 4 weeks at the Edinburgh Fringe.

Engineered Arts are kindly providing our robot actor gratis, but unfortunately we still have expenses to cover. Here's a breakdown of where the money needs to go:

Venue hire/deposit

 £ 1,400

Rehearsal and production costs

£ 7,900

Travel, transport and accommodation

£ 2,500

Salaries for actors and director through the show

£ 6,500

Subtotal

£18,300

Anticipated income from ticket sales and Latitude fees

-£ 6000

Funding gap 

£12300
Of course, on top of this, we also have to fulfil our backer rewards and perks, and pay our IndieGoGo fees! Which is why we're asking for at least £15000, to make sure you get what you want and we get what we need. All the money left over after fulfilment will be spent on the production costs of the play.


What can you get?

Let's get to the meat. What have we, the team, got for you, the backer?




  • Posters and t-shirts, all limited editions and brilliantly designed by Pipeline's graphic artist powerhouse.
  • Access to Engineered Arts' Virtual Robot software, where you can program and store your own RoboThespian routines.
  • Personalised thank-yous from the robot star, or even your own content programmed by us and performed by the robot, delivered to you via video.
  • Put your face on the robot! Digital immortality is just a button click away.
  • A projective head shell to hang on your wall and provide creative or technological inspiration.
  • Your name in the show programme - and for the very keen, an exclusive invitation behind the scenes at Edinburgh for a drink with the cast and a tete-a-tete with the robot.
  • Tour the RoboThespian factory in coastal Cornwall, a unique and unmissable experience.
You can even get your hands on a Socibot-Mini - a desktop-sized social robot with all the versatility and processing power of a full-sized RoboThespian. We'll let SB explain the details:


Where will the money go?

Amount raised

Fulfilment/ fees*

Remainder

What will we do?

<£15K

<£4950

<£10050

Walk to Edinburgh and Latitude – sleep in the van, eat beans and busk on the streets! But we won't lie, it will be tough.

£15K-£18K

£4200-£5000

£10800-£13000

Lets us properly pay our actors and director.

£18K+

£5K+

£13K+

Above this, all the money goes to more rehearsal time, upping the production values, set design, lighting – ie, making this the best show possible.

* 9% if we do not raise total requested, 4% for total raised + anything beyond.

Additionally, if we manage to raise more than anticipated, we have been invited to bring the play to a theatre in London, and work towards a regional tour.

We've made sure that no matter how much we raise, we can fulfil all our backer rewards. If we do raise less than our goal, we'll have to tighten our belts a bit and seek out other fundraising opportunities to fill the gap. The whole team is fully committed to bringing Spillikin to the stage - by whatever means possible. We hope if you're even as fraction as excited as we are, that you can spare a few quid to help us along the way.


'Spillikin' is a deeply personal project for us, and the character of Sally will resonate with anyone who has had to watch a loved one unravel due to Alzheimer's.

The development of Spillikins would not have been possible without the input and support of dementia patients, carers and experts, both local and from across the UK. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, sometimes you don't have any cash to spare! Believe me, in the theatre world we know all about that. But if you want to see us succeed and can help us out in other ways, that would be grand! Suggestions:

  • Tell people about the project.
  • Share the fundraising link.
  • If you're near Edinburgh at Fringe time, pop along and see the play. or let people who are going know about it. The bigger the audience at the Fringe, the better the chance we'll be able to tour Spillikin nationally.

story:
Help Us Bring the Vision to Life!

Acappella The Musical is coming to the New York Musical Theatre Festival (NYMF) in July 2015! You're invited to join the journey as we bring this one-of-a-kind musical spectacular to Broadway! We've put together an award-winning creative team and we're gathering world-class talent to create the next acappella sensation! It's a romantic comedy featuring soul-stirring, foot-stomping good music and a ton of laughs! All featuring 100% LIVE acappella singing! We've got 5 performances lined up for you, and we're excited to announce that Acappella The Musical is the opening night performance for this year's festival! Tuesday, July 7th @7pm at The PTC Performance Space, 555 West 42nd Street New York, NY 10036. 

The Story

Growing up in the church choir of a small southern town, Jeremiah and Simon were very close. Jeremiah and Sarah were even closer. Promising a quick return, Jeremiah jumped at an opportunity to fill in for a few weeks as a back-up singer for a touring pop group. It would be some years before his friends would see him again. 

On the cusp of his first international tour, Jeremiah is adrift in superficial connections and professional relationships. He makes a surprise visit to his hometown on the eve of its centennial celebration. His surprise visit stirs things up. Belying the fans and fanfare, not everyone is happy to see him. Jeremiah is disappointed that Sarah and Simon have moved on, but is it love or just nostalgia? Is he running towards something he wants or running away from something he fears? The message of this romantic comedy is reflected in the style of its music – acappella.


The Music

Now every vision has a genesis! The musical numbers featured in the production are the celebrated songs of 'The Acappella Company' - more commonly known as 'Acappella'. The group has sold well over three million units and toured every continent on the globe since Keith Lancaster - songwriter, producer, and original lead singer - formed the group. Believing in the awesome versatility and flexibility of the human voice, this renowned vocal group can fill a large concert hall with beautiful, intricate music without ever plucking a string or beating a drum. 

We Want Your Help!

The good news is we've already raised over $15,000 from some very generous major donors! Now, we're seeking your help to make sure that we can compensate the actors, designers, and the amazing creative team putting this project together. Acappella The Musical is a full-scale Broadway production featuring five performances in New York City! We're talking rehearsal space, set and lighting design, costumes, production fees - the works! 100% of your contribution goes directly to support the production! Plus we've got some great perks for all levels of donations!


The Plan

Where do we go after NYMF?? Hopefully to a city - or a country - near you! The acappella scene is exploding and our vision is for a national and international tour! And if all goes well - back to Broadway! Now, of course there's no guarantee of that - but we're going to make sure that some of the most prominent commercial producers in the world get to see this show. So we like our chances!

Join the Journey!

So pick a perk and make your contribution now! If you're planning to be in New York this Summer, come and see the show! You'll find the venue and the dates on our website. Even if you can't come, feel free to spread the word! Share this fundraising project on all of your social media. Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. And be sure to visit our website for updates: www.acappellathemusical.com. We'll see you on Broadway!

story:
Three Premieres... One Summer

Robert Mark Dance is a New Jersey based dance company committed to creating invigorating new works that push, reflect upon, and unveil the human experience through the use of performance and education.  By focusing on these two modes of inquiry, Artistic Director Robert Mark Burke discerns new and exciting ideas put forth into the creation of his dances..

Since the beginning of 2015, Robert has been offered three choreographic commissions.  Each commission is an undertaking with challenges, both creatively and financially.  Each new work will require roughly 30 hours of creation, collaboration with 2-7 dancers, the use of rehearsal space, and scheduled meetings with costume designers and sound collaborators.

 Fortunately, Robert Mark Dance has received funds from three different New Jersey-based performing arts organizations for these commissions; however, the sum of these generous donations do not amount to the costs needed to support the brilliant collaborators working closely with Robert Mark Dance.

What We Need

While each choreographic commission comes with funding to help supplement the costs of creating a new work, the costs of studio rentals (which can be at least $500 per project) and dancer fees quickly deplete the funds needed to cover the full budget needed to pay all of Robert Mark Dance's collaborators.
This being said, we are reaching out to you! Art lovers, dancers, family and friends to help us reach our goal of $3,500 to bring these three very different works to life!

The Impact

By supporting the artists of Robert Mark Dance, you are supporting the emerging voices of the New Jersey dance community.  With your help, we can continue to bring fresh and invigorating ideas to our audiences.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough, we get it! If you can't donate, please help us out by sharing this on social media and through emails! To volunteer for future events, please email RobertMarkDance@gmail.com!

story:
We will donate all money collected from running a stage show " Pirosmani" to help orphanages! 

Благотворительная кампания "Пиросмани" является проектом некоммерческой корпорации "Russian Masters Theater Projects", базирующейся в Голливуде. Вся прибыль от проката спектаклей передается на благотворительные пожертвования. Средства, собранные в течении кампании на платформе ИНДИГОУГОУ, пойдут на постановку спектакля "Пиросмани или праздник одиночества" по одноименной пьесе Вадима Коростылева. В главных ролях спектакля заняты русскоговорящие актеры Голливуда. Режиссер - постановщик спектакля Алим Кулиев. Художник - постановщик спектакля  литовский  и американский художник Сигитас Снирас! Активное участие в проекте принимает владелец актерского агентства Голливуда Виктор Круглов. Сумма, которую мы установили собрать на платформе ИНДИГОУГОУ - это сумма, недостающая для производственных нужд постановки спектакля. Все собранные от проката средства пойдут в помощь добровольческому движению " Даниловцы" , занимающемся организацией долгосрочной и регулярной работы волонтерских групп в больницах и сиротских учреждениях, а также в "МОЙ МИО" фонд (".....подопечные фонда — ребята со сложным и прогрессирующим заболеванием, это дети в инвалидных креслах.......но ЭТО ДЕТИ, которым хочется дружить, озорничать, петь, танцевать и ловить рыбу......интеграционный лагерь даёт шанс почувствовать этим мальчишкам ДЕТСТВО.....") и напрямую в детские дома, нуждающиеся в поддержке. Все учреждения и организации, которым будут перечислены средства, тщательно отобраны и проверены руководством корпорации " Russian Masters Theater Projects".

Руководство компании надеется, что данная информация поможет многим разобраться в целях этой благотворительной кампании и собрать необходимую сумму!

Если у Вас возникли вопросы, как внести пожертвование, обращайтесь, и мы с радостью поможем!

Команда проекта "Пиросмани"

 

                   

 

Celebration of Love and Spirit!

 
 
My name is Alim Kouliev.  I  have performed extensively as an actor for film, radio, and TV. I have twelve years of acting experience working in several leading Moscow theaters and I've performed many great characters in classic and contemporary theater productions, under the best Russian theatrical directors. in 1981 I moved in United States . After my comeback in 2004,  I am working in Hollywood as a stage actor. I also continued to work in Hollywood as a  film actor since 2007.
 

 

Here are a few of my well know projects... 

 

              

 

A Glimpse Inside the Mind of Charles Swan III 

 

 

Medal of Honor (2010)

 

 

The Curious Case of Benjamin Button (2008) 
and

                                                                                                

                                                                                           "The Americans" - TV series (2013)
 
Our company in production process of Master and Margarita - epic show based on  Mikhail Bulgakov's novel.

We will tell you about that project later!

At this time we would love to share with people inspirational story of the Artist 's life. To show you, his dreams, his unconditional love, and passion. We want you to think about your existence in this world. One of the best ways to achieve this task, as actors, is to create a stage show! We can assure you that your help will make an important contribution to the cultural life of Los Angeles!

Money

We have everything we need to bring our show to you - our audience!!!!!
 
We have a talent! We have experience! We have skills! The only one thing keeping us from inviting you to our theater is $7,777. 
 
  1. We need to pay $2,000 to rent a theater you will enjoy our show at.
  2. We need $1,800 to make the information about our show dates and location accessible to wide public.
  3. We need  $ 1,000 for equipment to make an impression of the show even greater.
  4. We need $895 to dress the stage and fill it with scenery to satisfy your view ecstatically.
  5. We have to pay $700 to "Indiegogo"  to have a success with this campaign. 
  6. We need $667 to make the sound of the show pleasureful and soft.
  7. We need $300 to make our characters look sharp.
  8.  We need $225 to make the things our characters will play with.
  9. We need $200 to have the all other little things done.
 
 

 And we will donate all money collected from selling tickets to Orphan House!  

Gratitude

We love theater, we love our audience, and we love when our fans leaving happy and inspired and most of all, we want you to feel our gratitude. So we have some great gifts to appreciate your generosity. You will get a chance to have famous actors to hang out with and have some unique memorable perks with our stars autographs!

 

"The Americans"     

Alim Kouliev and Annet Mahendru
 
 

 

The Impact

All funds we receive from your generous contributions will toward production expenses - not a penny will go anywhere else! And if we don't to reach the target of $ 7,777, we will still put whatever we have into the production and will make sure to finish what we started!

 

Charity

I can not find words enough to express the importance of Theater's presence in our society. 

We believe that theater is important not only for our entertainment, but also to build a conscious culture within a generation that is quickly slipping away from being cultured.

" Theater has a culture of its own that many people don’t understand. To those that do understand it, they often make it a very large part of their lives. Plays are sometimes attempts to spread awareness about problems like racism, sexism, homophobia, and other types of persecution. The playwrights write about something that matters to them as their form of expression. These issue plays help our society better function because they cause individuals to realize what is happening and take action. It builds a passion in many groups of people because they realize what is really important to them and that they have the power to make a change. Theater is a powerful medium for exposing problems because those who understand it know how real and active theater is in the world."

 

"Theater helps to bridge the gap of our misunderstanding of why we exist. For many people, theater also gives a purpose for life. Human beings naturally want to express themselves, and theater is the most expressive art form. “This is why theater is important: because it presents a reflective vision of a life that is vastly more fascinating and alluring than the one in which we’re stuck.” -                                                                                                                                                                                                              Lemoney Snicket

 

So, if you are someone who wants to change the world around you, understand yourself better, and want to make difference in your life, then this is a contribution you have to make.

 

Although our presence is on the stage, our hearts are with the orphans. This is our Mission. That all the proceeds of our event go directly toward repairing and maintaining orphanages in Russia. I fully believe that it's hard for anyone to ignore this without making a contribution:

 

                           

There are many  Orphanages in terrible condition . We want you to think about children without deprived of love and affection, because  we will donate all money collected from selling tickets to this Organization:  Danilovtsy

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand this  is a hard time right now and the economy is affecting everyone! You might not be able to make a contribution. But there are other ways you can help us!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Share our Indiegogo campaign using the "Share Tools" to and let other people know about our campaign!

story:
A bit about the project

Hi, My name is Ian Parsons, and I am the Director of the yet to be launched Point(e) Taken Dance Theatre, and choreographer of what will be our inaugural launch piece No Exit, which is based on the play of the same name written by the great existentialist Jean-Paul Sartre.

A Canadian by birth, I trained at the Maritime Conservatory of Performing Arts in Halifax, Nova Scotia, before moving on to full time training at Canada's National Ballet School. Throughout my training, I always had a keen interest in choreography, and was indeed a regular contributor to the annual Stephen Godfrey Choreographic Workshop, which is held every year at the school. I have also had the privilege of choreographing for the National Ballet of Canada's apprentice company, YOUDance, as well as the main company's annual workshop. 

The creation of No Exit will be fulfilling one of my biggest dreams of not only producing my own work outside the constrains of a workshop, but also of launching my own company: Point(e) Taken Dance Theatre.

Most excitingly however, this project will see the creation of not only an entirely new narrative ballet, but also a totally original score, which is being composed by my friend and collaborator, Tom Barnes (Hear Tom's Soundcloud HERE). Tom is an exciting young talent in the UK music world, and I am thrilled to have the opportunity to be inspired by his genius.

Our budget

First and foremost, my priority is to make sure that the people involved can afford to take the time that is necessary to create this new work, and if I cannot afford to pay the dancers the London living wage of £9.15 per hour at this time, then I will only begin rehearsals when I can afford to do so. As we are only raising money for the creation of the work at the moment, we are looking for the following: 

4 dancers at £9.15 per hour: £2196.00 (for 60 hours) 

2 creatives at £9.15 per hour: £1098.00 (for 60 hours) 

60 hours worth of studio time at £25.00 per hour: £1500.00 

Also, we are looking to have the set pieces constructed for the end of the rehearsal period, prior to a preview showing: 

3 made to measure Perspex sheets, wheels, a door, benches and transport: £553.00

Preview showing rental fee: £400.00

Total: £5747.00

    What you get 

    Besides being among the very first to support this new company in its infancy, there are a multitude of ways for us to thank you for your contributions. Read further to find out more! 

    Thank you! 

    No matter what your contribution, or even if you cannot contribute, thank you for taking the time to read about us. And most importantly, help us get the word out!

story:
We are bringing a new production to rural Pennsylvania, but we need your help!

After a successful inaugural production of David Auburn's Proof last year in Pottstown, PA, the local community let us know they wanted more live theater.  So we're coming back, staging Annie Baker's gorgeous, Obie Award-winning play Circle Mirror Transformation on the same property.  We are extraordinarily lucky to have access to Sycamore Hill, a beautiful country home, which lets us take theater outside the theater and get up-close-and-personal with our audience. Sycamore Hill's porch, house, and surrounding environs were our set for Proof, and Circle Mirror Transformation will be performed outdoors on the property's lawn.

Theater with a View is now a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a 501(c)(3) arts service organization, which means that any donations to TwaV are tax-deductible.  It also means that after our initial production, we have committed to taking Theater with a View to the next level and continuing to help actors and theater artists crack open fresh opportunities and create for the benefit of their communities, new audiences, and each other.  

To meet audience demand, we've doubled our performances this year and spread them over two weeks.  

But we need your help!  And we've got some fun perks lined up to show our gratitude.

We are keeping our production slim and trim, but we aim to raise $9,000 to help cover unavoidable costs, including:

  • Building our stage: This is new this year!  In 2014, we used Sycamore Hill's actual porch in our site-specific staging of David Auburn's Proof.  We're using the same property this year, but Sycamore Hill does not have a rec room or community center to stand in for the room where Marty holds her drama classes in Annie Baker's play. You know what that means?  Cue the circular saw and the building of platforms. Luckily, our stage manager and technical director, Corrie Beth Shotwell, is a card-carrying PRO on the stage and set front. 
  • Production of promotional materials: Help us build our audience by letting them know we're back!  Our grassroots effort in the community last year led about 200 audience members to come see a play where there had never been a play before! Posters, postcards, and postage are the building blocks of our outreach to the local community . 
  • Equipment rentals: lights, lighting gear, and other technical equipment
  • Paying our actors. . . and our crew: We have a cast of professional actors who are already doing this more for their hearts and for their audiences than for a paycheck. They are sacrificing other opportunities in NY to work together and create something fresh together.
  • Travel: Getting our cast and crew from New York to Pennsylvania and home again. Twice. 
  • Feeding the cast and crew 
  • Fees: for the rights to perform the play
  • Chairs, a port-a-potty, other amenity rentals: For all the benefits of using the beautiful property at Sycamore Hill instead of a theater, it also presents some specific challenges and needs!

Our Cast (& director, too) 

Our cast of actors are Steven Fogelman as Schultz, Michael Hajek as James, JC Sullivan as Marty, Nina Covalesky as Theresa, and Jaz Zepatos as Lauren.  Nina and Michael return after their turn as Catherine and Robert in Proof  last year.  Also back aboard is Seth Reich as director.  

The Play

Circle Mirror Transformation won the Obie Award for Best New American Play in 2010, an honor it shared with another play by Annie Baker, The Aliens.  Annie is an exciting young playwright who seems to be everywhere these days:  She won the Pulitzer Prize in 2014 for The Flick, currently being produced at Barrow Street Theater in New York, and the world premiere of her new play, John, opens at The Signature Theatre on July 22.   

No Money?  No Problem! Other Ways You Can Help

Can't help Theater with a View and our production of Circle Mirror Transformation financially right now?  Not a problem!  

You can still lend an invaluable hand by sharing this campaign, spreading the word, and helping us build our audience.  Facebook, Twitter, emails, word of mouth, smoke signals--- all are pieces of the big ole helpful pie.  We can't stress the importance of this piece of the puzzle enough and we will be truly grateful for any and all word of mouth promotion. 

And, of course. . . you can always just come see Circle Mirror Transformation and share the experience with us.  

Thank you!

No Money?  No Problem! Other Ways You Can Help
Can't help Theater with a View and our production of Circle Mirror Transformation financially right now?  Not a problem!  
You can still lend an invaluable hand by sharing this campaign, spreading the word, and helping us build our audience.  Facebook, Twitter, emails, word of mouth, smoke signals--- all are pieces of the big ole helpful pie.  We can't stress the importance of this piece of the puzzle enough and we will be truly grateful for any and all word of mouth promotion. 
And, of course. . . you can always just come see Circle Mirror Transformation and share the experience with us.  
Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Jason Karman and I'm a filmmaker in Vancouver, Canada. I've been writing-directing shorts for 10 years.  As director, my works speak to the journey of self, exploring how we communicate and where our place is in an ever-changing world. In my quest to reinvent and grow, dance has provided me with a new vocabulary by allowing a more vivid and truthful expression of self without the limitation of words. 

I was introduced to established American choreographer Nicolo Fonte through Ballet BC in 2012. This duet connects with me on an emotional level; the act of two men supporting and balancing one another is poetic and serves as an allegory for my personal relationships. 

MUSE is a dance film about a young man who discovers the stranger he is having a relationship with is his future self. 

The film cuts-in between a field, a natural open space, and an intimate place that is darker and dreamlike. These conflicting spaces are metaphors of our public and private thoughts. It is a commentary on the challenges of moving forward while aging; I find comfort in familiarity, but my curiosity invites opportunity and new challenges. 

I have chosen stereoscopic 3D to increase the emotional transference between the dancers and audience. Accurate recreation of depth, volume and roundness brings audiences closer to dance. Tying the arc of the dancer's story with the intensity of the 3D allows for a more intense emotional journey. 

Story

The film starts with our young man, Avery, walking in a field. He is following a path. He is curious about the world and this curiosity creates a sense of magic realism that is communicated through close-ups, a montage of the world. He meets Chauncey, a lonely stranger, and engages him; the two begin to move together. The relationship starts to evolve as their support for one another turns into a romantic connection, falling out of the waking life into dream space.  Through the loss of an outside background reference, the open field, the relationship starts evolving.

Familiarity begins to permeate through the relationship in the form of repetition. They are both striving to build something together, but Chauncey doubts Avery. As scenes are deconstructed, reality and dreams are blurred intensifying the effect that the characters are transcending. Reality pushes into the dream, breaking it down, and it takes its toll on Chauncey. Avery, the optimist, encounters resistance from his stubborn companion. Through the use of a mirror in the dream space, Avery sees his future self in Chauncey.

While they may have shared a common goal (they are travelling on the same path), their perspectives change. By building an association of the dream space with Avery’s face and reality to Chauncey’s features, we create a visual language that these two are diverging. The montage intensifies until Chauncey stops, his feet firmly rooted on the Earth. Avery invites Chauncey to continue with him, but he does not move. We see them shake hands outside. Both are enriched by the experience of being together, but Avery chooses to move on; we follow him as he creates a different path. 

What We Need & What You Get

In January 2015, the Dance Film Association (DFA) in New York selected the project for support; they have contributed $450 US towards the project, and will provide assistance with distribution, increasing presentation opportunities for the work. The DFA partners with the Film Society of Lincoln Center to present Dance on Camera, shares work outside of New York through Dance on Camera Tour and online distribution platform VHX. 

In order to go into production, we need to raise $13,000. The film will be shot in Vancouver, Canada. Your contribution will go towards securing and feeding professional dancers and crew, camera equipment and additional support, production design including set materials and make-up, gas and transportation. Every dollar helps and you’ll be supporting the entire team realize this project. The money raised will also be used for sound design and festival admission fees. Many of us have volunteered our time because we believe in the project and the team.

We are offering some perks to encourage you to help us make this film. Please see the bar on the right of your screen for details. 

The Impact

The image of two figures locked in a physical conversation through space is compelling.  Collaborating with an international choreographer invites new perspectives, raises the caliber of the work, setting precedence and creates innovation.

Bridging cinema and dance, S3D technology motivates audiences on the ever changing perception of depth between dancers, not only will they have close intimate emotional exchanges where we’ll compress the world around them, they’ll also feel the massive expanse their tribulations create by stretching the world apart. 

Raising the awareness of dance and 3D in North America, audiences and participants will hopefully find new ways of thinking, which will in turn translate to increased engagement opportunities for all. 

This is new territory for me as many of my earlier works have only been in 2D. I have been able to create work that connect and engage with the immigrant experience and the discovery of personal identity. My films have screened internationally at Asian and Queer film festivals, bringing attention to the Pacific Northwest. 


Supporting me is a fantastic team of professionals, many of whom I've had the privilege of working with in past projects. For the team this represents an opportunity to try something new. I'm excited at being able to work with them again and be part of their success.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute funds to our campaign. Can you tell your friends about it, and share the link? Post it on your Facebook? IndieGoGo makes it easy with the "Share" tools on this page. Tweet about it? We would be eternally grateful!


Update July 9, 2015

Muse has been selected by National Film Board of Canada for the 2015 Filmmakers Assistance Program. The project will receive up to $5000 of in-kind support in production and post-production services. 

US tax receipts are now available for contributions to this project. Please click here: Dance Film Association. You will be directed to the website of non-profit organization outside of IndieGoGo.

story:
(version en español abajo)

Help us bring this play to the Hispanic Theater Festival of New York

The video above is a small example in which we introduce you to the universe of a new play that offers a tribute to theater and it highlights the profession of acting and the transcendence of its spirit beyond the stage.

The King of France (El Rey de Francia) tells the story of a Shakespearean actor (Garrick) that starts to lose his mental sanity. Garrick confuses a young journalist (Alfredo) who seeks Garrick to interview him backstage with an actor who is expected to audition. In the middle of the interview– amid delusions and monologues of Shakespeare– the old man subjects him through several acting tests to prove his skills in the job; meanwhile the young man deals with personal doubts and insecurities and even though he has lived all his life dominated by fear, agrees to play along to get the interview he urgently need for his new job. The unexpected arrival of a young actress (Flora) will take the state of affairs to the limit causing a climax in the lives of both characters which will trade off fears, past loves, and secrets that will, along the narrative, drive to confront their inner demons in the middle of an interview that must take place and a show that must go on.

The play is a dramatic comedy by Fermin Reina that –with your contribution– will have a world premiere in the V Festival de Teatro Hispano del Comisionado (Commissioners Hispanic Theater Festival) that will take place in the months of May and June of 2015. Our play will take place on June 11th 2015.

The Commissioners Hispanic Theater Festival The Festival is an exciting event that from its inception has dedicated itself to the purpose of recognizing and celebrating the contributions of the actor’s community in the Big Apple and its surrounding areas. The festival each year has a bigger impact in the Latino community in New York City and the event is promoted by the Dominican cultural commissioner of the United States.

In this 5th edition of the festival, we have been invited to participate along 23 other theatrical companies of New York and other cities of the United States and many other countries. It will be a joyous celebration of Hispanic American theater and we believe it is the perfect showcase to bring this theatrical piece to life. We are sure it will impact the hearts of our fellow actors and our beloved general public.

The artistic ensemble of El Rey de Francia (The King of France) is integrated primarily by talented Venezuelans where most are residents of New York City.

The cast of three actors consists of Adriana Galindez, a beautiful and talented actress that recently moved to New York after acting in theater and television for a number of years in her native Venezuela; Pablo Andrade, who has been awarded with a 2015 Latin ACE Award and two 2014 HOLA Awards; and Dimas Gonzalez, who is one of the most important figures in theater and film in Venezuela. Mr. Dimas Gonzalez has been a recipient of more than 15 international and national artistic awards including Premio Nacional de Cine (2008), Best Actor in the International Film Festival of Milan and Festival of Breckenridge and Municipal Award of Film Roman Chalbaud (2010).

This production will be co-directed by Dimas Gonzalez and Pablo Andrade, but assisted by the technical direction of Alfonso Rey, and assistant director Yessi Hernandez, music by Ruben Riera, makeup by Jose Miguel Dao, stage manager Maria Fernanda Padilla and associate producer Fernando Rendon..

Produced by Corezon Productions and the support of Venezuelan Arts Festival.


Corezon Productions burst into the New York scene with force by showcasing Cuentos de Guerra para dormir en paz by Karin Valecillos, performing in HB Studio and in the IV Commissioners Hispanic Theater Festival being awarded 9 nominations including best production, direction, set and light design. .

Venezuelan Arts Festival (VAF) was created with the mission to recognize the importance of Venezuelan art and to provide a platform to showcase it in New York and around the world. The VAF conducts annual events where it unites the best Venezuelan creativity abroad.

This campaign is to gather funds for the production and particularly the airfare expense of the actor and co-director Dimas Gonzalez that must be acquired in advance because of the economic crisis in Venezuela. The travel expense of Mr. Dimas Gonzalez is out of reach of our budget capability and with your generosity we can make this theatrical production a reality. We are offering free tickets for contributors of $20 or more among other series of additional great incentives. If you are unable to donate please help us spread the word of our wonderful and heartfelt project. Let not miss this great opportunity and experience! This artistic proposal comes from the most profound depths of our hearts and it is for you, the public. The following is an excerpt of the conversation that initiated this project, it is an email that Pablo Andrade wrote to Dimas Gonzalez (who was his first acting mentor) shortly after reading El Rey de Francia (The King of France).

“Dimas, I have read the play and it has moved me. The theme is perfect for our artistic reunion. After so many years, to be on stage with you as Garrick, guiding my steps to defeat fear on stage and in life... it takes me back without a doubt to those first steps when I was still terrified, but with your assistance I dared to create. Presenting this play would be of great meaning for me at this stage of my career and this play is beyond any festival or recognition. My reward would be to leave my soul on stage at your side. Let’s do it!"


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Ayúdanos a traer esta obra al Festival de Teatro Hispano de Nueva York

El video arriba es una pequeña muestra que busca introducirnos al universo de una nueva obra que ofrece un homenaje al teatro y que pretende resaltar el oficio del actor y la trascendencia de su espíritu más allá de la puesta en escena.

El Rey de Francia nos cuenta la historia de un viejo actor shakesperiano (Garrick) que comienza a perder la cordura. Garrik confunde a un joven periodista (Alfredo) que acude a su camerino para entrevistarlo, con un actor que ha venido a buscar trabajo en su compañía de teatro. En medio de la entrevista ­–entre delirios y monólogos de Shakespeare– el viejo lo somete a varias pruebas de actuación para probar sus aptitudes dentro del oficio, mientras el joven, entre dudas e inseguridades personales, y a pesar de que ha vivido toda su vida dominado por el miedo, participa en el juego del actor para obtener la entrevista que necesita urgentemente para su nuevo trabajo. La llegada inesperada de una joven actriz (Flora), llevará la situación al límite y provocará el clímax en las vidas de ambos personajes, que se entrecruzan entre miedos, amores del pasado y secretos que van saliendo a flote a lo largo de la pieza y que los empujarán a enfrentarse con sus monstruos internos en medio de una entrevista que debe realizarse y un show que debe continuar.

Es una comedia dramática original de Fermín Reina que –con tu contribución– tendrá su estreno mundial en el V Festival de Teatro Hispano del Comisionado ha realizarse en mayo y junio de este año. Nuestra obra tomará lugar el 11 de junio de 2015.


El Festival de Teatro Hispano del Comisionado es un excitante acontecimiento que desde su fundación, y con el propósito de reconocer la labor y celebrar los aportes de la comunidad de artistas del escenario, ha reunido a las compañías consolidadas y emergentes de la Gran Manzana y alrededores. Tiene cada vez un mayor impacto en la comunidad latina de la ciudad. El evento es auspiciado por el Comisionado Dominicano de Cultura en los Estados Unidos.

Esta quinta edición, a la que hemos sido invitados, contará con la participación de 23 agrupaciones teatrales de Nueva York, otras ciudades de Estados Unidos, Colombia, Puerto Rico, Cuba, Republica Dominicana, etc. Será una fiesta de teatro hispanoamericano y creemos que es la vitrina perfecta para dar luz a esta pieza que consideramos llegará a los corazones de nuestros colegas actores y público en general.

El equipo artístico de El Rey de Francia ha sido conformado por creadores venezolanos, en su mayoría residentes de Nueva York:

Un elenco de tres actores: Adriana Galindez, bella y talentosa actriz que se ha mudado recientemente a NYC luego de varios años de estar activa en el teatro y televisión de Venezuela; Pablo Andrade, que ha sido merecedor de un Premio ACE 2015 y dos Premios HOLA 2014, y Dimas González, que es una de las figuras más importantes del teatro y del cine de Venezuela y ha sido galardonado con más de 15 reconocimientos nacionales e internacionales, entre los que destacan el Premio Nacional de Cine (2008), los Premios como Mejor Actor del Festival Internacional de Cine de Milán y el Festival de Breckenridge y el Premio Municipal de Cine Román Chalbaud (2010).

Será una co-dirección de Dimas González y Pablo Andrade, apoyados en la dirección técnica de Alfonso Rey, asistencia de dirección de Yessi Hernández, música de Rubén Riera, maquillaje de Jose Miguel Dao, asistencia de escena de María Fernanda Padilla, y Fernando Rendón servirá como productor asociado.

La producción está a cargo de Corezon Productions y cuenta con el apoyo de Venezuelan Arts Festival.


Corezon Productions irrumpió con fuerza en la escena neoyorquina con el montaje Cuentos de guerra para dormir en paz de Karin Valecillos, con presentaciones en el HB Studio y en el IV Festival de Teatro Hispano del Comisionado donde se alzó como la agrupación con más nominaciones –nueve– incluyendo Mejor Producción, Dirección, Escenografía e Iluminación. 

Venezuelan Arts Festival (VAF) creado con el objetivo de reconocer la importancia del arte venezolano y proveer una plataforma para exhibirlo en Nueva York y alrededor del mundo. El VAF realiza eventos anuales donde reúne lo mejor de la creatividad venezolana en el extranjero.


Esta campaña la realizamos para recaudar fondos para la producción y particularmente para el pasaje del actor y co-director Dimas González que debe ser adquirido con premura y que, por la situación económica de Venezuela, la devaluación y el control de cambio; tristemente se ha alejado de nuestro presupuesto. Dependemos de tu generosidad para la realización de la pieza, estamos ofreciendo boletos gratuitos si contribuyes con $20 o más y además una variada serie de incentivos adicionales. Y si no puedes donar, ¡ayúdanos a correr la voz!

¡No nos perdamos de esta experiencia! Esta propuesta artística ha salido desde lo más profundo de nuestro corazón y va dirigida al de ustedes. El siguiente es un extracto las conversaciones que iniciaron este proyecto, es un email que Pablo Andrade le escribió a Dimas González (quien fue su primer mentor en la actuación) apenas luego de leer El Rey de Francia: 

"Dimas, he leído la obra y me ha conmovido. El tema es perfecto para nuestro reencuentro artístico.  Luego de tantos años, estar en escena contigo como Garrik, guiando mis pasos para vencer mis miedos al escenario y a la vida, me lleva sin duda a aquellos primeros pasos cuando, aún estando aterrado, con tu ayuda me atreví a crear.  Hacer esta obra tendrá un gran significado para mi en este momento de mi carrera. Esta obra está más allá de un festival o reconocimiento. Mi recompensa será dejar el alma sobre las tablas allí contigo.  ¡Hagámoslo!"

residentes de Nueva York: 
Un elenco de tres actores: Adriana Galindez, bella y
talentosa actriz que se ha mudado recientemente a NYC luego de varios años de
estar activa en el teatro y televisión de Venezuela; Pablo Andrade, que ha sido
merecedor de un Premio ACE 2015 y dos Premios HOLA 2014, y Dimas González, que es una de las figuras más
importantes del teatro y del cine de Venezuela y ha sido galardonado con más de
15 reconocimientos nacionales e internacionales, entre los que destacan el Premio
Nacional de Cine (2008), los Premios como Mejor Actor del Festival
Internacional de Cine de Milán y el Festival de Breckenridge y el Premio
Municipal de Cine Román Chalbaud (2010).
Será una co-dirección de Dimas González y Pablo
Andrade, apoyados en la dirección técnica de Alfonso Rey, asistencia de
dirección de Yessi Hernández, música de Rubén Riera, maquillaje de Jose Miguel
Dao, asistencia de escena de María Fernanda Padilla, y Fernando Rendón servirá
como productor asociado.
La producción está a cargo de Corezon
Productions y cuenta con el apoyo de Venezuelan Arts
Festival. 




Corezon Productions irrumpió con fuerza en la escena neoyorquina con el montaje Cuentos
de guerra para dormir en paz de Karin Valecillos, con presentaciones en el HB
Studio y en el IV Festival de Teatro Hispano del Comisionado donde
se alzó como la agrupación con más nominaciones –nueve– incluyendo Mejor
Producción, Dirección, Escenografía e Iluminación. 


Venezuelan Arts Festival (VAF) creado con el objetivo
de reconocer la importancia del arte venezolano y proveer una plataforma para
exhibirlo en Nueva York y alrededor del mundo. El VAF realiza eventos anuales
donde reúne lo mejor de la creatividad venezolana en el extranjero. 


Esta campaña la realizamos para recaudar
fondos para la producción y particularmente para el pasaje del actor y co-director Dimas González que
debe ser adquirido con premura y que, por la situación económica de Venezuela,
la devaluación y el control de cambio; tristemente se ha alejado de nuestro
presupuesto. Dependemos de tu generosidad para la realización de la pieza, estamos
ofreciendo boletos gratuitos si contribuyes con $20 o más y además una variada
serie de incentivos adicionales. Y si no puedes donar, ¡ayúdanos a correr la
voz!
¡No nos perdamos de esta
experiencia! Esta propuesta artística ha salido desde lo más profundo de nuestro corazón y va dirigida al de ustedes. El siguiente es un extracto las conversaciones que iniciaron este proyecto, es un email que Pablo Andrade
le escribió a Dimas González (quien fue su primer mentor en la actuación) apenas
luego de leer El Rey de Francia:  

"Dimas, he leído la obra y me ha conmovido. El
tema es perfecto para nuestro reencuentro artístico.  Luego de tantos años,
estar en escena contigo como Garrik, guiando mis pasos para vencer mis miedos al
escenario y a la vida, me lleva sin duda a aquellos primeros pasos cuando, aún
estando aterrado, con tu ayuda me atreví a crear.  Hacer esta obra tendrá un
gran significado para mi en este momento de mi carrera. Esta obra está más allá de
un festival o reconocimiento. Mi recompensa será dejar el alma sobre las tablas
allí contigo.  ¡Hagámoslo!"

story:
Short Summary

We are staging the debut production of the rock musical "Mary Howling", inspired by a true story.  Mary responds to the bullies at school by entering  a "blue forest" where she creates a phantasmagorical world  peopled by her toy animals and the truth-speaking Golden Throat pull string doll.  With this fantastical support from her home, Mary faces down the hate spewing residents of Eggbone City.

What We Need & What You Get

  • All funds go toward putting on a great show
  • costumes, logistics, travel, rehearsal, equipment 
  • be recognized as a supporter, gifts, SWAG  

The Impact

The difference your contribution will make: get this original, timely, epic show on the road! And beyond great entertainment, empower the ostracized to sing out!

    Risks & Challenges

    There are no risks, the show is booked August 12th 15th 17th @ Hudson Guild Theater, at 441 W. 26 St.(between 9th and 10th Avenues).

      Other Ways You Can Help

      In addition to funding; any equipment for the performance/rehearsal would be a help, transportation for cast, fashion, in-kind contributions, contact us.

story:
Odradek Theatre Company needs your help to fund our brand new play, Hobohemia: Disorderly Conduct as One of the Fine Arts.

Hobohemia is a Chicago play.  An exploration of the Dil Pickle Club in its heyday to its last day, Hobohemia will explore the lives of the great revolutionaries of this country’s short history: anarchists, atheists, priests, hobos, teachers, doctors, women’s rights activists, scientists, and many, many more.

The history of our great city is being buried under parking garages and sports bars named after people who dreamed of change of a different kind. Through music, dance, poetry, and debate we will bring their stories back to a city that needs them once again.

Odradek is so proud to be producing this brand new devised work at the Bughouse Theater, our new partner in artistic crime. Odradek is now the resident company at Bughouse's brand new storefront space.  This is why we need your help! We need lights, sound, seats, and everything that goes into a great theater as well as money for our designers, actors, costumes, and set.

We are asking for $4,500. This money goes to our new lights and grid, our set, our costumes and props, our actors, and our designers. You will be helping us to not only put on a brand new devised work about Chicago's little-known and exciting history, but to build a home where we can produce all sorts of original work. Your contribution will be put to good and sustainable use, as everything we purchase or build will stay in our new home for new projects to come, and everything we pay to our loyal artists and designers is fed directly into a thriving arts community.

A play is not a play unless someone watches it. Your contribution helps us build a home for ourselves and our audience. It helps us explore history, ask big questions, and train our craft. It helps us bring theater to a neighborhood in Chicago without artistic outlets. It helps us grow.

If you can't donate right now, no problem! Please tell everyone: your friends, family, loved ones, pets, contract professionals, elementary school teachers since retired, and anyone else you can think of about or campaign and our company. Make sure to visit our website, odradektheatre.com, for updates, bios and news!

story:
Who We Are:

Our mission: Living Space Players is an ensemble of artists dedicated to creating vibrant, innovative and immersing theater brought right to your doorstep.

What L.S.P does is bring live theater performances to your home or provided space. Like a personal chef that you hire for a dinner party, or a string quartet coming to play in your home, we offer you a theatrical performance for you, your family and your friends!

By contributing to our campaign you're helping us to create a professional production with high value. It will also help us to run our business as proficiently as possible, ensuring that we are able to create more shows for your enjoyment!

What We're Asking For:

Living Space Players is asking for $4,000. Here's where your contribution will be going:

  • Business expenses: Insurance, marketing and advertising.
  • Artistic expenses: Props, costumes and other elements to increase production value and immerse you deeper into the worlds we create.
  • Travel expenses: Transporting our trunk show performances to and from your home or provided space.
  • Pay for our actors and collaborators: The folks we work with are very talented and professional. Most important to us is to compensate them for their efforts.
Check out what we're offering for your donation on the Perks page!
Note about $10 perk: Please email livingspaceplayers@gmail.com with your song request!

Giving Back

We want Living Space Players to build and strengthen communities and spread the art of theater as far and wide as possible. For every show you book and pay for, part of the profits from that performance will go towards donating shows, classes and workshops to community establishments! We're working to build relationships with various organizations such as community centers, schools, churches, shelters, charities and non-profits. Not only are we giving back to the community but so are you when you support us!

Some Challenges

As with any new artistic and business venture, there are challenges such as:

  • Ensuring a mutual feeling of comfort and safety between L.S.P and you as our valued client. To facilitate this we will consult with you a minimum of two weeks in advance; and a final meeting a minimum of one week before your desired performance date.
  • Dry spells. As with catering and other services similar to this, there are seasons where business will be slow. We will plan ahead financially for the slow seasons and continue to work hard on adding more shows and booking them.
  • Expanding as far and wide as possible. We have big goals for L.S.P. We want to make ourselves available to Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn, the Bronx, Long Island, the Hamptons, basically the entire state of New York! One of our long-term goals is to establish ourselves as a company in New York and then travel, creating Living Space Players artistic communities in other states, cities and eventually abroad!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to make a donation, no worries! We understand times can be tough. Just taking a look at our page is appreciated. If you like who we are and what we want to do, here are some other ways you can help us out!

  • Share our campaign!
  • Tell your friends, tell your family, tell your colleagues, tell ANYONE who might be interested!
  • Check out our website: www.livingspaceplayers.com
  • Give us a like on Facebook: www.facebook.com/livingspaceplayers
  • Follow us on Twitter: @_LSPlayers
  • And Instagram: @livingspaceplayers
Thank you so much for your help! See you at home!

story:
Who We Are

Momentum brings innovative theatre to a diverse audience with our traveling stage truck and internationally trained ensemble of teaching theatre professionals. We take to the road to celebrate the diversity of community, to encourage environmentally responsible living, and to inspire others to reach yet undiscovered imaginative heights through workshops and performances.

We are also an international and intercultural organization, with an active artist exchange program between France and the US. 

We could not have gotten this far without you, and, as we make our final fundraising push, we are asking for your generosity once again. Every donation helps move us along the way to providing quality, accessible theatre performance and education in communities around the country.

This Summer

On August 14th, we will embark on our 5th Annual Summer tour. 

This season, we will be performing a conglomeration of three plays :  Alfred Jarry's "Ubu Roi,” and local New England playwright-Larry Jay Tish’s “The Break up of Cause and Effect" both directed by Sean Eastman, and an adaptation of Shakespeare's history, "Henry the Fifth," directed by Jasmine Roth. In combination we've entitled our night of work: "Pa and Ma's Traveling Spectacularium: A Causality Puppet Circus of Chaos." 

We currently have 20 performances scheduled as we travel from Northern Maine to Washington, D.C, stopping in NH, VT, MA, NY, and NJ along the way. 

What We Need 

In order to continue offering accessible, professional theatre arts performance and education, MTT relies on the support of many generous individuals, corporations, and foundations. Because we want all people, regardless of socio-economic status to have access to our performances, we have made the conscious decision not to charge admission to our performances. There are, however, many significant expenses associated with a traveling theatre. These include:

  • Transportation - A traveling theatre-truck is a wonderful thing, but gas can get pricey
  • Salaries for our Cast and Crew- We are proud to pay our hard-working professional actors. 
  • Administration- Printing, publicizing, vehicle insurance, you name it. 
  • Production- Costumes, props, lighting and sound systems... Everything that makes theatre the fantastic surreal experience that it is

The Impact

By supporting  Momentum Theatre Troupe, you will be demonstrating your commitment to accessible, quality professional theatre arts performance and education. Our impact extends into our community in the following ways:

  • Our movement-oriented re-workings of traditional Shakespeare texts bring the pieces into the 21st century, making them newly accessible to a modern audience
  • The free, outdoor nature of our performance space allows for people with disabilities, families with energetic young children, who those who might  normally be inhibited for financial reasons, to access quality professional theatre
  • Our in-school workshops and residencies provide a viable, affordable option for schools experiencing budget-cuts to reintegrate art into their curriculum 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute, there are a variety of ways in which you can support MTT and our mission to bring quality, professional theatre to communities around the Northeastern United States:

  • Come see a performance!
  • Do you know of a town or organization that would benefit from an MTT performance? Let us know!
  • Keep the momentum going by spreading the word-- link out to our facebook page at www.facebook.com/MomentumTheatreTroupe and check out our website www.theatretruck.com

story:
Who we are 

We are a group of international students from around the world who are studying acting at Hanyang University in Seoul, South Korea.  This semester, we have decided to join our creative forces to create our own piece of theatre: physical theatre.  We would like to create a new kind of work that has never been seen in Korea before and we want our audience to experience something they have never had the opportunity to experience before. Physical theatre is a new idea for the theatre community in Korea, and by creating this type of work, we are hoping to attract both the foreign and Korean communities to share a unique theatre experience together. We believe that more than words, our bodies can communicate to tell a story and send a stronger message that is universal in thought and expression. 

저희는 세계 각지에서 모여 한양대학교에서 연기를 공부하고 있는 국제 학생 단체입니다. 이번 학기에, 저희는 저희들끼리 작품을 만들 수 있는 기회를 받았습니다. 그래서 저희는 '신체극(Physical theatre)'을 만들기로 결정하였습니다. 저희가 신체극을 선택한 이유는 신체를 사용하여, 움직임에 집중되는 창조작업이 저희의 작품을 더 보편적이고 많은 사람들에게 전달할 수 있을 거라고 생각하였기 때문입니다. 그리고 색다른 스타일의 연극이 관객들에게 새로운 경험과 즐거움을 줄 것입니다.

我們是來自世界各地的學生​​，現就讀於韓國漢陽大學的戲劇表演系。我們熱愛戲劇但作為留學生在韓國可以擁有自己的機會少之又少，但是這次我們成功向學校申請到了機會，以形體劇（physical theatre）的表演方式進行創作。但我們為什麼選擇形體劇？我們覺得利用肢體語言去表達可以擁有更多創造和想像空間，無需言語也可以向所有人傳達我們的內容和含義，給觀眾帶來全新的感受.

What is Project Inferno

Based on the classic piece of literature, Dante’s Inferno, we strive to create a piece of theatre that is not only entertaining, but will also have an impact on the people who watch it.  We are motivated to ask the question of how people are living today and what type of society we are creating. We feel that the idea that people need to experience hardship or ‘hell’ in order to reach satisfaction and happiness ‘heaven’ is a universal message that everyone can relate to. By using the nine circles of Hell that Dante describes, we will discuss the ideas of personal responsibility for our actions and the results of the choices we make. We also want to explore the idea of how our individual decisions affect not only ourselves, but also our society and even our universe. We would like to share this message in hopes of getting people to think about what kind of life we are living and how we can become better people, not only for ourselves, but for our community, society and world.

고전 문학인 단테의 <신곡>을 기반으로 하여, 저희는 관객들에게 메시지를 전달하기 위해 이 작품을 작업하고 있습니다. 저희는 "사람들은 오늘날 어떻게 살고 있는가? 우리는 어떤 종류의 사회를 만들고 있는가?"에 대한 질문으로부터 출발하였으며, 사람들이 '천국'과 행복, 만족을 느끼기 위해서는 '지옥'과 어려움을 경험해야 한다고 생각합니다. 이것은 모든 사람들에게 통용되는 보편적 메시지입니다.

以經典文學《神曲》為基礎，發展出今天我們一直在討論的問題“現代人的思考方式？”和”我們活著一個怎麼樣的社會裡？“從這兩個問題出發，我們認為《神曲》中”地獄“和當代社會相似，所受到的苦痛，現代人也在感受著，希望可以讓觀眾有一個重新思考自我的機會.

What We Need & What You Get

As creative and resourceful students, we would like to keep our budget to a minimum; however, there are some expenses that we cannot provide by ourselves. Therefore, we are seeking support from our community. The dollars you give will go to help fund our venue, rehearsal space, sets, costumes, props, and advertising. If we exceed our fundraising goals, we will donate the remaining funds to charity. We are not looking to make any profit from this project. We just want to create a meaningful piece of theatre that can be enjoyed by all who are a part of it. By donating to our project, we can achieve this dream together and create a very special experience for all to enjoy. 

Anyone who donates will be given a shout out on social media. Other perks include being advertised in our performance program and on our posters. 

  • Show Dates: Thursday November 5th- Sunday November 8th 
  • Location: Ando Cafe in Itaewon

가장 큰 예산 지출 비용은 공간 대여에 들어가는 비용입니다. 기타 비용은 소품과 의상, 포스터와 광고들을 포함하고, 최소한의 비용으로 할 수 있도록 노력할 것입니다. 우리 프로젝트에 기부 된 돈은 공연비용으로 쓸 것이며 공연 끝나고 돈을 남으면 필요하는 자선단체에 기부할 것입니다.

現在我們面臨最大的一個問題是公演所需的費用，包括公演場地，服裝道具，燈光海報還有廣告到宣傳，作為學生我們的能力還是有限的，但為了更高水平的演出，我們需要您的幫忙.

The Impact

As students who are taking a journey down a road that has never been taken before here in Korea, this project is not be possible without your donations. Every little bit helps us to achieve our dreams. 

As with any project, there are always risks and challenges. But fear not, there are no risks involved with your donation. Our biggest challenge will be to create the type of work that we believe will make a difference in our society and to have our audience understand and enjoy it. Then again, isn't that what art is all about? 

Thank you for your interest and for helping us to make our dreams come true!

이번 프로젝트의 목표를 달성하기 위해, 저희는 여러분들과 함께 작품을 만들고 싶습니다. 단지 저희에게만 의미가 있는 것이 아닌, 저희를 도와주신 모든 분께 의미 있는 작품이 되기를 바랍니다.

為完成這個計劃我們還需要很多努力，也很感​​謝你們的支持與關注，這不僅僅是一部學生作品，更希望可以喚醒現代人的反思，謝謝!
story_txt:
Who we are  

We are a group of international students from
around the world who are studying acting at Hanyang University in Seoul, South Korea.  This semester, we have decided to join our creative forces to create our own piece of theatre: physical theatre. 

We would like to create a new kind of work that
has never been seen in Korea before and we want our audience to experience
something they have never had the opportunity to experience before. Physical
theatre is a new idea for the theatre community in Korea, and by creating this
type of work, we are hoping to attract both the foreign and Korean communities
to share a unique theatre experience together. We believe that more than words,
our bodies can communicate to tell a story and send a stronger message that is
universal in thought and expression. 
저희는 세계 각지에서 모여 한양대학교에서 연기를 공부하고 있는 국제 학생 단체입니다. 이번 학기에, 저희는 저희들끼리 작품을 만들 수 있는 기회를 받았습니다. 그래서 저희는 '신체극(Physical theatre)'을 만들기로 결정하였습니다. 저희가 신체극을 선택한 이유는 신체를 사용하여, 움직임에 집중되는 창조작업이 저희의 작품을 더 보편적이고 많은 사람들에게 전달할 수 있을 거라고 생각하였기 때문입니다. 그리고 색다른 스타일의 연극이 관객들에게 새로운 경험과 즐거움을 줄 것입니다.


我們是來自世界各地的學生​​，現就讀於韓國漢陽大學的戲劇表演系。我們熱愛戲劇但作為留學生在韓國可以擁有自己的機會少之又少，但是這次我們成功向學校申請到了機會，以形體劇（physical theatre）的表演方式進行創作。但我們為什麼選擇形體劇？我們覺得利用肢體語言去表達可以擁有更多創造和想像空間，無需言語也可以向所有人傳達我們的內容和含義，給觀眾帶來全新的感受.

What is Project Inferno

Based on the classic piece of literature, Dante’s Inferno, we strive to create a
piece of theatre that is not only entertaining, but will also have an impact on
the people who watch it.  We are motivated
to ask the question of how people are living today and what type of society we
are creating. We feel that the idea that people need to experience hardship or
‘hell’ in order to reach satisfaction and happiness ‘heaven’ is a universal
message that everyone can relate to. By using the nine circles of Hell that
Dante describes, we will discuss the ideas of personal responsibility for our
actions and the results of the choices we make. We also want to explore the
idea of how our individual decisions affect not only ourselves, but also our
society and even our universe. We would like to share this message in hopes of
getting people to think about what kind of life we are living and how we can
become better people, not only for ourselves, but for our community, society
and world.
고전 문학인 단테의 <신곡>을 기반으로 하여, 저희는 관객들에게 메시지를 전달하기 위해 이 작품을 작업하고 있습니다. 저희는 "사람들은 오늘날 어떻게 살고 있는가? 우리는 어떤 종류의 사회를 만들고 있는가?"에 대한 질문으로부터 출발하였으며, 사람들이 '천국'과 행복, 만족을 느끼기 위해서는 '지옥'과 어려움을 경험해야 한다고 생각합니다. 이것은 모든 사람들에게 통용되는 보편적 메시지입니다.


以經典文學《神曲》為基礎，發展出今天我們一直在討論的問題“現代人的思考方式？”和”我們活著一個怎麼樣的社會裡？“從這兩個問題出發，我們認為《神曲》中”地獄“和當代社會相似，所受到的苦痛，現代人也在感受著，希望可以讓觀眾有一個重新思考自我的機會.
   What We Need & What You Get 

As creative and resourceful students, we would like to keep
our budget to a minimum; however, there are some expenses that we cannot
provide by ourselves. Therefore, we are seeking support from our community.
The dollars you give will go to help fund our venue, rehearsal space, sets, costumes, props, and advertising. If we exceed our fundraising goals, we will donate the remaining funds to charity. We are not looking to make any profit from this project. We just want to create a meaningful piece of theatre that can be enjoyed by all who are a part of it. By donating to our project, we can achieve this dream together and create a very special experience for all to enjoy. 
Anyone who donates will be given a shout out on social media. Other perks include being advertised in our performance
program and on our posters. 



Show Dates: Thursday November 5th- Sunday November 8th 


Location: Ando Cafe in Itaewon


가장 큰 예산 지출 비용은 공간 대여에 들어가는 비용입니다. 기타 비용은 소품과 의상, 포스터와 광고들을 포함하고, 최소한의 비용으로 할 수 있도록 노력할 것입니다. 우리 프로젝트에 기부 된 돈은 공연비용으로 쓸 것이며 공연 끝나고 돈을 남으면 필요하는 자선단체에 기부할 것입니다.


現在我們面臨最大的一個問題是公演所需的費用，包括公演場地，服裝道具，燈光海報還有廣告到宣傳，作為學生我們的能力還是有限的，但為了更高水平的演出，我們需要您的幫忙.
    The Impact As students who are taking a journey down a road that has never been taken before here in Korea, this project is not be possible without your donations. Every little bit helps us to achieve our dreams. 
 As with any project, there are always risks and challenges. But fear not, there are no risks involved with your donation. Our biggest challenge will be to create the type of work that we believe will make a difference in our society and to have our audience understand and enjoy it. Then again, isn't that what art is all about? 
Thank you for your interest and for helping us to make our dreams come true!
이번 프로젝트의 목표를 달성하기 위해, 저희는 여러분들과 함께 작품을 만들고 싶습니다. 단지 저희에게만 의미가 있는 것이 아닌, 저희를 도와주신 모든 분께 의미 있는 작품이 되기를 바랍니다.


為完成這個計劃我們還需要很多努力，也很感​​謝你們的支持與關注，這不僅僅是一部學生作品，更希望可以喚醒現代人的反思，謝謝!

story:
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO

It's our mission to pay artists at Stark Naked Theatre. As Houston's professional actors' theatre, we employ professional artists and pay them a competitive wage for the Houston market. That's a big deal for Houston. In fact, it's a big deal for the nation. Theatre artists are not guaranteed a minimum wage for their work. They put in hours of work to present to you, and we believe they deserve a fair wage for their work.  When you contribute to Stark Naked Theatre you are making great art happen and are an important part in helping pay professional artists for the work they are extensively trained to bring you at the highest quality available to us to hire so that you are able to experience the "extraordinary performances" we make it our mission to bring you.  

In order to make this happen, we run a lean business. And as you can see below, we always stay true to our mission.

WHAT WE NEED

Ticket sales aren't enough for us to pay our artists. Your contribution will help us to produce Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf this year. And we believe that this $30,000 sum will be enough to ensure our bases are covered post ticket sales.

This campaign is so important because it's what makes Stark Naked possible. We don't do big fundraising galas or events because we don't want to divert funds from our artists. We will host a donor appreciation party in April 2016 to celebrate our wonderful and supportive patron and donor community!  We spend ALL of our time and resources making sure you get the "Extraordinary Performances: Up Close," that we're known for.

And this is exactly where your donation goes: to artist pay and production costs. What you donate to this campaign you will see when you come to our theatre - it goes to the costs of production and payroll for artists.  Philip and I serve YOU and making your experience in the theatre the best it can be and we spend many hours making sure what we spend and how we make budgetary decisions are always based on your theatre experience being EXTRAORDINARY at Stark Naked!  Artists being compensated a fair and equitable wage for their professional talents provides them with the support and work conditions they need to be able to produce the best artistic product in order to deliver to YOU the highest caliber theatrical event that you can experience.  Creativity does not come from depravation!  Now, what do we pay our artists..?  There is not one actor in Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf making more than $300 a week....think about that...would you work for $300 a week (before taxes)???  Our designers and Directors and Stage Managers weekly wages fall in the $200 - $300 a week range as well.  We believe we can do better than that!!!  But right now we don't even know if we can raise the funds to cover this season.  We need your help!

We recently made a capital improvement to the theatre so that your viewing experience would be better!  We bought $27,000 risers so that you could enjoy our extraordinary performances even more!  What that means is our "wallet" took a big hit and we need your help more than ever to get it filled up again to be able to meet payroll.  Come on out to the theatre and see how AMAZING it looks!!!  There is a picture of the theatre on the "extras" page so you can get a peak!

WHY WE NEED YOU

We're a growing theatre and Houston's professional actors' theatre because of donors like you. This year, we've had to increase our budget by about 25% to both meet our increasing production needs and to continue to work toward our mission of paying artists a living wage - which we still aren't quite able to do.  This year we are also bringing you some amazing outside award winning artists and are putting in new studio risers to help improve your performance viewing experience all while keeping our ticket prices and concession prices low. We have expanded our development team to tackle these budgetary needs, and we hope that with this campaign, we can make sure we make it through this season into the next one.

OUR FUTURE

To tell you the Naked Truth: our future and growth is full of risk and possibilities. We hope that you will donate to this campaign to make sure we continue to contribute not only to Houston's thriving theatre scene, but also to the National stage as well.

story:
Short Summary

Acting Innocent Theatre Company was created by a group of ambitious teens from Tucson, Arizona. This group of talented individuals all share the same passion for theatre. They all met while performing in a national competing one act "Boys Next Door". This show sparked their flame to create a theatre company. The mission of this company is to put on provocative shows, that evoke emotions in the audience, as well as promote discussion within the community about modern social issues that are not heavily addressed in our day to day lives.

What We Need & What You Get

All of the funding that we obtain from you goes straight into the company. The money will  be used for renting theaters, rehearsing plays, and building sets. This money, if raised, will help us keep the company afloat and make sure we keep putting on high quality plays! Check out our perks to see the benefits you will receive from donating to our cause!

The Impact

Our ultimate goal in this company is to make our community feel something. We want our audience to see things in a new light. Every play we choose will have a topic or underlying theme that people need to be more aware of. At the end of every show there will be a discussion, in which the audience is encouraged to give a candid opinion. Art motivates individuals to embrace their community, and to respect the modern challenges faced by many. 

Risks & Challenges

A strong risk we run into when creating a theatre company is failure to satisfy our community. We believe to have some of the most talented actors in the city. Yet we cannot fulfill our dreams of acting if we do not have the funds to put on these shows. One of the advantages we have is that there are no other provocative theatre companies in Tucson. We also believe our repertoire could come off as vulgar and crude but we believe our target audience will appreciate us bringing to light several important themes.

Other Ways You Can Help

You don't have to donate to help us out! You can also share the campaign on your social media! And lastly you can come support us directly at our shows in Tucson, visit our website for more information, acting innocent.com. Spread the word about our company!

story:
The Dance Complex
Towering high above the Massachusetts Avenue skyline and nestled in the heart of central square Cambridge there sits a historic dance building, where every week over 1,200 movers come to build dance.



Our Dream
It has been a long-standing dream to expand our programmatic offerings and establish a street-level, accessible space in the already vibrant community of Central Square, Cambridge.  Thousands of people hear the music pouring out of our building, but they do not get to see or be inspired by the moving art that is being created within.

With $55,000 from our community, we will be able to complete our renovations for a multi-functional rehearsal, performance, and event space - Studio 7.  The final elements of the project include sound containment, ventilation, and a new facade. This new facade will mark a transformation wherein The Dance Complex will have a street level presence, where dance will have a portal to the community, and the community will have a view in on the beauty of bodies in motion. 



Why give to The Dance Complex
The Dance Complex is a model arts organization, bringing tremendous diversity, arts appreciation, instruction, and mentorship to the local community including:
-90  classes per week
-38 distinct movement styles
-home to 33 local dance companies
-subsidized studio and performance for dance artists
-internationally recognized teaching artists and guests
-award winning choreographers in performance
-robust programming and mentorship

The Dance Complex  is run by 7 part-time employees, and the dedication of a corps of over 100 workstudy volunteers.


 

While we are rich in very many ways we must invest in our future.  We call on all those who love The Dance Complex, who love dance, who want to see a secure and bright future for dance...we call on you for your help.


Our Future
Over the last 24 months The Dance Complex has undergone remarkable growth--we have raised $58,000 towards our multi-year fundraising campaign.  We are so excited to be forging partnerships with organizations and foundations that further The Dance Complex's mission and renewed goal to make dance truly accessible to all.  We are just now celebrating the unprecedented gift of $500,000 from The Barr Foundation. 

At this pivotal moment we are turning to you, our community.  We ask you to take a stake in the future of The Dance Complex. Please partner with us to raise $55,000 to complete and unveil our first-ever street level rehearsal, performance, and event space.
