story:
Who is Cue 1? And why do they want money?

Spokane is a great city. It's not too big and it's not too small. In Spokane, there is no greater sense of community than the small arena that we know as live theater. Live theater is thriving in Spokane with talent that has gone to big and bright careers in the arts. Local high schools are constantly winning regional awards as well as local theaters doing there part on the national level. Cue 1 wants to join that success as a startup theater that will bring Spokane another option for professional theater. Cue 1 will be a professional non-equity house that will perform 9 shows per season with 2 summer season shows aimed at providing internships to local school aged kids at no charge to the students. Our summer season is focused on mentorship of students by local professionals who work in the field here in Spokane. Every student will be paired with a professional actor and some nights the role will be played by the professional and some nights it will be performed by the student. Again, this is at no charge to the student and the professional gets paid at the same time! As for the 9 shows, we will bring both contemporary shows and classics including both musicals and plays. Ticket prices will be $25 for musicals and $20 for plays. We have found a space available for a price we can afford and we are ready to move in. We need your help. Cue 1 Theater will be a corporation as opposed to a non-profit and as such we are not going to hound you for donations. Instead, we will use this medium as a way to sell you goods in order to raise the funds we need to launch on schedule this July. If we do not reach our goal, the funds you have donated will go into the business bank account and will remain there until we have raised the startup amount. Rest assured, we are not going anywhere. We will continue to sell goods until the time comes that we have raised our goal and then we will launch as soon as possible. I want to thank you for viewing our page. Thank you for considering partnering with us by purchasing something in our indiegogo campaign. Most importantly, thank you for supporting the arts every time you go see a show at any theater anywhere.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $15,000 for Startup costs
  • All funds received will be applied to the startup costs NOT employees.
  • Startup Costs Include: Securing a building, Chairs for the auditorium, lighting and sound equipment, minor remodeling.
  • You get something for your money. This is not a donation.

What we want to bring Spokane

We understand the unique balance between performing for the sake of art and the need to present shows that the community wants to see. The following is our list of shows that we want to bring you as soon as we open.

A Chorus Line

A Christmas Story

Alice in Wonderland

Almost Maine

Annie

Band Geeks

Beauty and the Beast

Best Christmas Pageant Ever

Chicago

Cinderella

Death of a Salesman

Doubt: A Parable

Footloose

Godspell

I Love You, You're Perfect, Now Change

Into the Woods

Jekyll & Hyde: The Musical

Mama Mia

Matilda

Noises Off

Oklahoma

Once: A Musical

Pippin

Plaid Tidings

Pride and Prejudice

Rent

Rocky Horror Picture Show

Sister Mary Ignatius Explains it all For You

Songs for a New World

Sweeney Todd

The Chronicles of Narnia

The Complete Works of William Shakespeare Abridged

The Foursome

The Little Mermaid

The Odd Couple

The Secret Garden

The Sound of Music

The Wizard of Oz

The Woman in Black

These Shining Lives

Tick, Tick, Boom

You Can't Take it With You

You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't buy anything, please share this on your page! Others may see this and be interested.
  • We are looking for many different people to help with operating the theater and because we are a professional theater, we will not ask you to volunteer. You will be compensated.

Every student will be paired with a professional actor and some nights the role will be played by the professional and some nights it will be performed by the student. Again, this is at no charge to the student and the professional gets paid at the same time! As for the 9 shows, we will bring both contemporary shows and classics including both musicals and plays. Ticket prices will be $25 for musicals and $20 for plays. We have found a space available for a price we can afford and we are ready to move in. We need your help. Cue 1 Theater will be a corporation as opposed to a non-profit and as such we are not going to hound you for donations. Instead, we will use this medium as a way to sell you goods in order to raise the funds we need to launch on schedule this July. If we do not reach our goal, the funds you have donated will go into the business bank account and will remain there until we have raised the startup amount. Rest assured, we are not going anywhere. We will continue to sell goods until the time comes that we have raised our goal and then we will launch as soon as possible. I want to thank you for viewing our page. Thank you for considering partnering with us by purchasing something in our indiegogo campaign. Most importantly, thank you for supporting the arts every time you go see a show at any theater anywhere.   What We Need & What You Get  $15,000 for Startup costs All funds received will be applied to the startup costs NOT employees.
Startup Costs Include: Securing a building, Chairs for the auditorium, lighting and sound equipment, minor remodeling.
You get something for your money. This is not a donation.    What we want to bring Spokane
We understand the unique balance between performing for the sake of art and the need to present shows that the community wants to see. The following is our list of shows that we want to bring you as soon as we open.

A Chorus Line
A Christmas Story
Alice in Wonderland
Almost Maine
Annie
Band Geeks
Beauty and the Beast
Best Christmas Pageant Ever
Chicago
Cinderella
Death of a Salesman
Doubt: A Parable
Footloose
Godspell
I Love You, You're Perfect, Now Change
Into the Woods
Jekyll & Hyde: The Musical
Mama Mia
Matilda
Noises Off
Oklahoma
Once: A Musical
Pippin
Plaid Tidings
Pride and Prejudice
Rent
Rocky Horror Picture Show
Sister Mary Ignatius Explains it all For You
Songs for a New World
Sweeney Todd
The Chronicles of Narnia
The Complete Works of William Shakespeare Abridged
The Foursome
The Little Mermaid
The Odd Couple
The Secret Garden
The Sound of Music
The Wizard of Oz
The Woman in Black
These Shining Lives
Tick, Tick, Boom
You Can't Take it With You
You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown
Other Ways You Can Help
  If you can't buy anything, please share this on your page! Others may see this and be interested.
We are looking for many different people to help with operating the theater and because we are a professional theater, we will not ask you to volunteer. You will be compensated.

story:
Short Summary

Jackie Shikora and Kellie McMenemon are two senior theatre majors at SUNY Oswego. For their senior capstone’s, they are both looking to produce Dunkin Sheik’s musical Spring Awakening.

Throughout their collegiate years both girls have contributed greatly to the SUNY Oswego theatre department and all the shows within it.

Spring Awakening is a coming of age rock musical that deals with Controversial issues that need to be heard. This show follows late 19th century German teenagers as they discover their own sexual identities.

This production will be directed and choreographed by Jackie Shikora and Stage Managed/designed by Kellie McMenemon.

This is Jackie Shikora’s and Kellie McMenemon’s first time producing a show at this level. They are overly grateful to have the opportunity to re-create such a revolutionary show and deeply thank everyone for their help in turning this big idea into a reality!

What We Need

At this time, we have received some monetary support from SUNY Oswego's Blackfriars theatre organization. However, in order to make this production a reality, we are still in need of more support.

The majority of the funds raised will go towards the rights and licensing of Spring Awakening. As of right now, the estimated cost is roughly $1,700.

The Impact

The impact for the audience: Spring awakening is a powerful show that deals with controversial issues that are often overlooked. Any audience member will leave this show feeling something, and may rediscover an important issue relevant today.

The impact for the producers:This endeavor is a crash course to the production side of theater.  This past September, our University's theater embarked on a two year renovation, which lead us to producing this show off campus.  While searching for a location for this production of Spring Awakening, we ran into numerous obstacles. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Donating to our campaign isn't the only way you can help us out. Help us by spreading the word! Any form of support is greatly appreciated. Get the word out about our upcoming production and invite people to see, support, and donate to Spring Awakening.

Thank you so much for taking time to learn more about this project. We hope you are interested in donating to our show. Every little bit helps make this production a reality!

When does the show open?

This production will run from  Friday March 6th to Saturday March 7th. House opens at 7:00pm. Show will start at 7:30pm.
Tickets can be purchased at the door for $5!
Location: Oswego Civic Arts Center Fort Ontario Complex, Oswego NY

story:
Short Summary

The Southern Vermont Dance Festival is working is working to host Daniel Ulbricht, Principal for the New York City Ballet and his dancers in Brattleboro Vermont on April 20th.  The dancers will perform at the beautiful and historic Latchis Theater!  We have not before had the opportunity to host such amazing professional ballet in Brattleboro.  In order to make this happen we need your support!

This performance will include two couples.  3 Principle dancers and one soloist who regularly dance with NYCB and Stars of American Ballet.  

Stars of American Ballet travels to cities that rarely host ballet performances and offers top-notch choreography with principal and soloist-level dancers from major American companies. Founded and directed by New York City Ballet principal dancer Daniel Ulbricht, who works alongside Executive Director Andrew Robertson, Stars also sponsors dance education programs, consisting of master classes, pre-performance lectures and community outreach projects, to build a better awareness and overall experience with the art form, and offers free tickets for underprivileged children.

The mission of Stars of American Ballet is to one day see all parts of this country entertained, educated, lifted up and inspired by the art of ballet and great dancing, delivered to anyone, anywhere who wishes to share this experience.

Proceeds from this performance will go to support the Southern Vermont Dance Festival!

What We Need & What You Get

This is such an amazing opportunity!  This is what we need to make this happen and this is what you will see as the result!
  • We need to raise a minimum of $10,000 dollars for Theater Rental, Housing for the dancers, Travel for dancers, Artist Fees, Costume Rentals and Royalties. If we raise more it will go to promoting, reception, scholarships for SVDF and more.
  • There are amazing perks such as: Meet the dancers (How often do you get the chance to meet and schmooze with professional Ballet Dancers, Wonderful Reception, Naming the theater, Tickets to the Show, Priority Seating, Signed and autographed photo of the dancers, Southern Vermont Dance Festival Pass's, tickets to SVDF galas and more!  As you can see there is a lot of benefit to giving to this event.
  • If we do not reach our goal we will still bring an amazing company to SVDF this year with the money raised!  So it is a win win!! However, lets go ahead and reach our goal and bring Professional ballet dancers to our small town.
The Impact

This project is important because thanks to Southern Vermont Dance Festival and all of the amazing dance programs in our area such as: Vermont Performance Lab, Brattleboro School of Dance, Sobo Studio, IBIT Dance Company and Keleido Dance, Brattleboro is becoming a dance hub for New England.  Whether people just come for the summer festival or they travel to our town for one of the incredible performances that happen throughout the year, our town is getting more traffic because we are known as a hub for dance.  

Here is what bringing Principals from major Ballet Companies will do for our town:

  1. Give our town major exposure in the dance world which will help get people to our classes, performances and most importantly it will inspire people from around the country to contribute funding to our programs.
  2. Bring people to our town to shop and eat!  The more major events that happen in Brattleboro, the more feet on the street.  This is 50% of the goal of the Southern Vermont Dance Festival and now we are bringing this benefit throughout the whole year.  4 days is just not enough! We want people shopping and eating throughout the entire year!
  3. Expose people to a type of dance that is not often available in our area.  Professional ballet usually means traveling to a major city!  What if we could offer that in our town!  Thus exposing our young people and adults to something that is not always available to them. 
  4. Put's us on the map for dance and other cultural events!  Makes us, Brattleboro, not just a high ranking visual arts community, but, also exposes us as the high ranking performing arts community that we are.
  5. Allows us to bring more of this type of dance to SVDF and beyond!  Shows the community that they do in fact want to support dance!!

    Challenges

    There are some challenges to bringing people of this caliber to the Latchis

    • The stage is not a huge and "normal" dance stage.  Finding companies and professionals that are willing to go out on that limb is rare.  However, once one company does this, many will follow!  So if we build it, they will come!
    • Money is a huge challenge.  To bring these major companies, we have to raise money.
    • Once we see these dancers, we will be hooked!  We will have to be able to find a way to bring these types of dancers again and again to Brattleboro!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Volunteer for this event
    • Volunteer to help us with the entire festival
    • be on the planning committee and help us continue to bring things like this to the town.
    • Be on the production team for the show.
    • Help us promote this show and sell out the seats.

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Dance International has a new home.

  Stewart Yaros, founder of Dance International, has been teaching dancers of all ages and levels in Austin for over 20 years. Dance International expanded its mission and purpose and became a 501 (c) (3) in 2011, in order to broaden DI's role in the community, and elevate the culture of Austin by offering more classes, organizing a variety of beautiful events,  and bringing world-class performers and teachers to Austin for the public to enjoy. 

The organization continues to grow, and has finally found a studio space that is all our own! We're now offering classes in youth dance, adult dance, and mind-body health from 6am-midnight.  Classes range from early morning meditation and yoga, to children's hip hop and ballet, to salsa dancing. Most evenings, we also hold specialized dance socials, such as Tango Milonga on Wednesdays, and Latin Dance Night on Saturdays. 

Until now, DI had sublet three separate studio spaces on a part-time basis, which was a challenge because we were always planning around the schedules of the primary owners/tenants, and were limited in our ability to grow into a true community arts, dance, and health center. 

The new studio is conveniently located in north central Austin, surrounded my a mix of commercial, medical, and residential properties. We offer special rates for all of our neighbors, in an effort to make Dance International a unique community destination. 


Our Mission is to create a center uniting people of all ages and cultures through the teaching and sharing of art, dance, music, and movement. 

We Believe that:

Art in all forms makes life richer.

Participation in art improves the mental, physical, and spiritual aspects of life.

Instruction and participation in multicultural art enriches both the art and the participants, and brings participants closer together.

The Earth offers the most incredible art of all kinds, and it is our responsibility to respect and protect it. 

Our Objectives in support of these beliefs include:

Enhancing and broadening the lives of under-served participants through instruction in art, dance and music.

Introducing participants to multiple disciplines of the arts to enrich their life choices.

Celebrating and encouraging cultural unity through art.

Providing a safe and healthy class environment.

Leading in ecologically-sustainable practices for building and operating.


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help with 
 In order of priority:
1. Mirrors: $2500. 
Mirrors for studios dance range from $2500-$6000 for purchase, delivery and installation. We will purchase from the lower end, because mirrors can be simple and still completely effective in aiding dancers and movers to learning moves, and before more familiar with their bodies. 
2. Laptop and software: $3000 
Apple with Access and Quickbooks for checking in guests. We are currently using a borrowed tablet with Square for taking payments, and an outdated office desktop for our business dealings. 
3. Signs:  $8000. 
We will put a sign on the front of our building and a sign on the side so that it may be viewed from Burnet, one of Austin's busiest roads. Quotes for signs vary, but the ones we like will cost about $8000. 
4. Marketing: $1000 . 
Fliers, posters, online ads, radio spot. 
5. Furniture: $3500 
We would like to add outdoor furniture for parents and guests to lounge while waiting for classes to begin or end; this is  really important because we don't have a lobby, only a  big studio, office, and bathrooms. We also hope to purchase two cocktail tables and 4-8 barstools for events and dance socials and 20 chairs for small demonstrations and events. 
If we do not meet our fundraising goal:
We will use whatever funds that we do raise in the exact order of priority outlined above. 
If there is any   " extra change" (e.g. not enough for a major purchase) we will use this for marketing: purchasing fliers, print materials, posters and online ads etc. and/or for smaller studio furnishings. 
What you get:
 We have great perks! Classes, private lessons, event tickets...Check out our "Perks" Section for more information.

The Impact

We are creating a fabulous cultural hub for the local community, and for the central Texas at large. We have teachers who have lived all over the world, including Mexico, England, Brazil, Thailand, Sweden, India, New Zealand, and South Africa ...and sometimes our classes look like they're sponsored by the UN! 


We already have talent, culture,  passion, artistic connections, and spirit; your help with this campaign will aid in developing our physical space. Being physically grounded in one place will help us to continue providing artistic excellence to the Austin community, and to expand our impact.

Previous successes:

  • We have been funded by the City of Austin's Cultural Contracts Division for fifteen years. 
  • We receive grants and donations for annual events, such as  the Austin Ballroom Festival, and  Austin Beautiful Summer (summer dance camps for children). We have always successfully executed these events. 

Risks & Challenges 

Until now, DI had sublet three separate studio spaces on a part-time basis, which was a challenge because we were always planning around the schedules of the primary owners/tenants, We were limited in our ability to grow into a true community arts, dance, and health center, and limited in our exposure. 

Now that we have our own place with a new, super full schedule, we need to rapidly increase our client base. If, after a few months, we are unable to sustain ourselves through class attendance, we will have to reevaluate our location and/or find other ways to earn income to pay our bills. We are optimistic that it will not come to this, because we have a large (~20) team of dedicated teachers and volunteers who are committed to the expansion and success of Dance International. We also have decades of experience managing income from classes, and grants allocated to us by the City of Austin. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about  our campaign, our new location at 2417 Buell Ave Ste. A Austin, TX, and our great new youth classes and mind-body wellness classes.
  • Share our IndieGoGo page, "Like" us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter or Instagram. 
  • Share our events and classes on social media
  • Volunteer! We are always looking for volunteers with different skills and talents. Contact info@dancein.org if you're interested in volunteering
  • Come to class or one of our events.

story:
About 4D6 Life the Play

In a world of trolls & gnomes, a paladin never really knows if they’re going to storm the castle or trip over their own feet. They are supposed to crusade in the name of good and order. But what happens when what you are supposed to do goes against what you feel is right? Where lawful good and chaotic evil meet sometimes you just have to decide when to roll the dice and when to just act.

4D6 Life is a play about expectations, diversity, fortitude, and life choices. It is a world where character traits are determined by a roll of a dice and pre-written prejudices.


"Puppets can say things that humans can't say."

4D6 Life is a 4 person play. However, it's also a world of tentacle carrion crawlers, vorpal bunnies, dragons, and sorcerers. All monsters and Non Player Characters (NPC) will be done with puppets.

The creators, designers, and puppeteers of 4D6 Life will be traveling to the Puppet School in New York in April to learn how to design, construct, and perform with the puppets. 

The Puppet School is one of the premiere puppet training schools. For many working with 4D6 Life, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity and a dream come true.

The total cost of the workshop, travel expenses and puppets is $2,000. Any extra money raised will go towards production costs and travel costs to the Hollywood Fringe Festival.

The Story of Construction and Hollywood Fringe Festival

4D6 Life is being work-shopped in Cleveland, OH with performance dates in May and June. The entire production will also be traveling to California for the Hollywood 2015 Fringe Festival.

The entire process from auditions to performance will be recorded and shared with contributors and supporters. This will be a fun perk for all of our supporters.

What We Need & What You Get

The $2,000 Cost of the Spring Puppet Workshop Breaks Down As:

  • $975 for the private workshop fee
  • $500 for room & board
  • $150 travel expenses
  • $375 puppet materials

In the event we raise more than $2,000, the extra will go towards :

  • $1050 Hollywood Fringe Registration and Theatre Fees
  • $3500 for room & board for the Hollywood Fringe Festival
  • $3500 for travel expenses for the Hollywood Fringe Festival

We have some fun-filled thank-yous for all our contributors including :

  • RPG Monster Handmade Stuffed Animals
  • Custom Munchkin Playing Cards
  • Dice bags and RPG themed purses
  • A chance to see your RPG character or monsters come to life in puppet or munchkin playing card form.
  • Your NPC or Monster added to the production of 4D6Life

Making Dreams Come True

Creative Dream Collaboration (CDC) Dramatics is all about making artists' dreams come true. 8 individual artists are working on 4D6 Life,

  • Sending 4 Actors to an International Fringe Festival
  • Sending 3 Artists to learn puppetry from the best puppet school in the US
  • Using independent full time artists for all promotional work
  • Helping fund the world premiere of a One Act Play.

We are in the process of filling our 501(C) status. Once we receive the official tax classification, donations ( minus the cost of materials or goods) can be filled on your taxes as a charitable donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Share on twitter, facebook, instagram or whatever social media you prefer
  • Use the hashtags #4D6Life or #that4d6life.
  • Watch,follow, and share the videos of the making of 4D6 Life.
story_txt:
About 4D6 Life the Play
 
In a world of trolls & gnomes, a paladin never really knows if 
they’re going to storm the castle or trip over their own feet. They are 
supposed to crusade in the name of good and order. But what happens when
 what you are supposed to do goes against what you feel is right? Where 
lawful good and chaotic evil meet sometimes you just have to decide when
 to roll the dice and when to just act.
4D6 Life is a play about expectations, diversity, fortitude, and life
 choices. It is a world where character traits are determined by a roll 
of a dice and pre-written prejudices.

 
 "Puppets can say things that humans can't say." 
 4D6 Life is a 4 person play. However, it's also a world of tentacle carrion crawlers, vorpal bunnies, dragons, and sorcerers. All monsters and Non Player Characters (NPC) will be done with puppets.The creators, designers, and puppeteers of 4D6 Life will be traveling to the Puppet School in New York in April to learn how to design, construct, and perform with the puppets.  The Puppet School is one of the premiere puppet training schools. For many working with 4D6 Life, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity and a dream come true. The total cost of the workshop, travel expenses and puppets is $2,000. Any extra money raised will go towards production costs and travel costs to the Hollywood Fringe Festival. The Story of Construction and Hollywood Fringe Festival
4D6 Life is being work-shopped in Cleveland, OH with performance dates in May and June. The entire production will also be traveling to California for the Hollywood 2015 Fringe Festival. 
The entire process from auditions to performance will be recorded and shared with contributors and supporters. This will be a fun perk for all of our supporters.
   What We Need & What You Get The $2,000 Cost of the Spring Puppet Workshop Breaks Down As:  $975 for the private workshop fee
 $500 for room & board
 $150 travel expenses

$375 puppet materials


In the event we raise more than $2,000, the extra will go towards : 
$1050 Hollywood Fringe Registration and Theatre Fees

$3500 for room & board for the Hollywood Fringe Festival

$3500 for travel expenses for the Hollywood Fringe Festival


We have some fun-filled thank-yous for all our contributors including : 
RPG Monster Handmade Stuffed Animals

Custom Munchkin Playing Cards

Dice bags and RPG themed purses
A chance to see your RPG character or monsters come to life in puppet or munchkin playing card form.
Your NPC or Monster added to the production of 4D6Life


  
Making Dreams Come True
 Creative Dream Collaboration (CDC) Dramatics is all about making artists' dreams come true. 8 individual artists are working on 4D6 Life,   Sending 4 Actors to an International Fringe Festival
 Sending 3 Artists to learn puppetry from the best puppet school in the US

story:
PROJECT DESCRIPTION

Renegade Performance Group (RPG) is presenting The AFROFUTURISM Series with two unique full-length programs: “Untitled Distances” and “The Inscription Project,” introducing dance and technology as a vehicle of AFROFUTURISM.  This will be the first RPG season in our home borough- Brooklyn. The company season runs for four nights, November 4-7, 2015, at the Irondale Center in Fort Greene. AFROFUTURISM as a movement, expresses new narratives, ideologies, and symbolisms of Black culture from a global perspective.

RPG launched the AFROFUTURISM Series in January 2014 to be an ongoing project investigating the presence of Blackness into and beyond 21st Century techno-culture and society. It is a platform where themes and contexts of Black diasporic culture will be remixed and reimagined through contemporary dance, digital projections, and interactive sound environments.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

This season is entirely self-produced! That's why we need your support to make the magic happen.

Our GOAL is $15,000.

The funds from this campaign support every step of this project’s process:

  • securing rehearsal and creative space,

  • printing publicity,

  • obtaining production equipment,

  • cover the cost of theater,

  • pay the collaborators and performers, and

  • video documentation of the performances

WE WANT TO LOVE YOU BACK

Contributors at certain levels receive unique incentives such as RPG phonecases, posters, vintage Haitian masks, the personal portfolio of André M. Zachery, and inside access to RPG.

11" X 17" Posters - Horizontal by Vistaprint
11" X 17" Posters - Horizontal by Vistaprint
Lightweight iPhone 6 Cases by Vistaprint
Lightweight iPhone 6+ Cases by Vistaprint

Official AFROFUTURISM Series/RPG T-Shirt by Allied Shirts


Small Leatherbound Haitian Mask (only 3 available)

Large Leatherbound Haitian Mask (12 available)

Portfolio of Artistic Director, André M. Zachery

OUR IMPACT

Renegade Performance Group was founded in Brooklyn in 2007 to engage a new generation of audiences with performance, media, and culture. The company was formed as an artistic outlet to foster dialogue compelled by the human experience. We collaborate with artists of all genres on projects that stretch the boundaries of performance presentation. The AFROFUTURISM Series, features collaborations with sound artists and composers Ivonne K. Paredes and Jeremy Toussaint-Baptiste, graffiti & visual artist Aaron “Spazecraft” Lazansky, and costume designer Joy Havens. The performers of RPG represent the diversity of Brooklyn in nationality, identity, gender, and dance backgrounds. RPG is building a new future with every artistic venture.

WHY NOW

AFROFUTURISM is a movement about collectively addressing issues on race, identity, and gender. RPG seeks your help in helping make another liberating space for expression, influence, and possibility through performance. Our work is your work too!

SUPPORT THE MOVEMENT

Now is your chance to join us in our movement by contributing to this groundbreaking campaign! Our accomplishments ARE POSSIBLE because of generous contributions by people like you. By helping us, you become part of the innovative spirit that makes the work of Renegade Performance Group meaningful! Your investment in us, is an invest in the power of AFROFUTURISM.

story:
THIS LIFE! THE MUSICAL - 10 wonderful, happy and creative years in the making. It began when Deb Silver, our composer, lyricist, writer and producer, fell in love with David Lean’s 1954 movie Hobson’s Choice starring Sir Charles Laughton and Sir John Mills.  She took her idea to theater and film professionals in New York in 2005. And from there the ideas blossomed.  10 years, 27 songs, sold out staged readings and standing ovations (with such a profound response the last show had to be moved to a larger Off Broadway theater), now, here we are.  

We've assembled a team of 14 incredibly talented actors, singers, a superb choreographer, a next level set and costume designer, an exceptional musical director, and our very own incomparable director, Terrence Montgomery, who has been with us since 2009. 

We are ready to take NYC by storm with a 3 week AEA showcase opening on November 2nd, the 100 year anniversary of the opening of “Hobson’s Choice” on Broadway, at the Desotelle theater in the Times Square Arts Center! 

But, we can’t do it alone. We need to raise $37,500 dollars to help cover the additional costs of the showcase and WE NEED YOUR HELP to do so!


THIS LIFE! a love story set in 1875 Victorian England, follows Maggie, as she takes care of her two younger sisters and her alcoholic father.  Never having a life of her own, Maggie finally makes a choice for herself that transforms her life and the lives of everyone around her.

Based on the play “"Hobson’s Choice”" by Harold Brighouse, the comedy and romance of “THIS LIFE!” is delightfully enriched with Deb Silver’'s memorable compositions, blending the musical styles of “Gilbert & Sullivan” and “The Beatles.”

 “.. Highly hummable and deeply satisfying..”



 Deb Silver is the composer, lyricist, and librettist of THIS LIFE! The Musical.  She is a jazz vocalist, composer and theater performer living and working in the United States and England.  In her work as a published songwriter, and recording artist,  Deb performs regularly at private parties and cabarets. She gave a successful sneak preview to  Prince William’s VIP guests at Kensington Palace of her latest Album "In Spring". Deb’s achievements include three one-woman musical shows, original songs which have been featured in independent films,  and as a vocalist in numerous bands and on studio albums.  Deb is the founder and director of the Silver Voice Method.

www.debsilver.com

Terrence Montgomery is a theatre director, actor, acting coach and teacher in NYC. He has worked as a director, lighting designer, stage technician, stage manager and actor in productions for Music Theater of Wichita, the Goodman Theater in Chicago, in NYC at The Public Theater, Carnegie’s Weill Recital Hall and Zankel Hall, at BMCC and Dance Theater Workshop, as well as in theatres in Denmark, Scotland, Russia, Poland, Georgia and Romania.






What more could you want than to be right in the heart of it all?  And John DeSotelle Main Theater is!  Located in the Times Square Arts Center, this 50+ seat theater is on the corner of 8th Avenue and 43rd Street, right in the theater district!


$12,000 Pays for 14 actors and 6 production staff -

$10,000 Rents a theater for 3 weeks of performances -

$7,000 Pays for a Music Director and musicians -

$4,000 Pays for lighting, crew, sets design & props -

$3,000 Rents space for auditions and 3 weeks of rehearsal-

$2,500 Pays for Costumer & Costumes -

$1,500 Pays for our programs & flyers/Ads -

$1,000 Pays for our insurance -

$850 Pays for printing of scripts & scores -

$750 Pays for our audition space & casting assistant -

$500 Pays for an accompanist -

$300 Pays for a stage-hand -

$200 Pays for orchestration edits on one song -

$100 Pays for 3 days coffee for cast & crew production -

$60 Pays for 3 scripts printed -

$40 Pays for 2 tickets (for You or comp. for Producers) -


Our audiences and producers will be 100% entertained and moved by this deeply loved story with brilliant songs that make audiences laugh, cry and remember that true love and hard work always pays off!

To see the musical come to life with top New York professional talent who want to shine their abilities and steer the show to success, this is the greatest feeling we could imagine! Help us make that dream come true!


If you can’t donate, even if you can, PLEASE SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN!  We are on instagram, twitter and facebook!  Help us spread the word! If you want more information about the show, please visit www.thislifethemusical.com


ALREADY DONATED AND NOW YOU WANT TO SEE IT?

BUY TICKETS HERE!! 

Previews Friday 10/30 and Saturday 10/31 
Opening Night** Monday 11/2
Main Show Tickets Thursday - Sunday 11/5 - 11/8 and 11/12 - 11/15

Support THIS LIFE! - The Musical 2015 Showcase


THIS LIFE! - The Musical 2015 Showcase is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of THIS LIFE! - The Musical 2015 Showcase must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.


Our campaign is over but you can still donate via Fractured Atlas: https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/fiscal/prof...

story:
About OLU...

When Olu's grades begin to slip, her Dad's convinced the solution to his problem is a Nigerian Boarding school.

“Overseas discipline is what she needs"

Conditioned to her London lifestyle she's left feeling lost and frustrated in an alien land fighting to hold on to who she really is. But what awaits is even more terrifying.

Through the play you will see a collation of Nigerian boarding school experiences through the eyes of a British-born Nigerian called Olu. Comedy, emotion and spoken word are found throughout Olu's culture shock, she is known as "Oyinbo" (white person) to her classmates and she has a lot to learn about their differences and similarities.

We meet Mr Johnson, a charming and warm teacher who reveals to Olu the pride he has in his own heritage. And to top it off, there is great drama and controversy when the Principals schemes come to fruition.

Olu is a poignant play that tackles the themes of identity, heritage and the displacement we fell when we are forced to leave our home. The play openly debate the media's perception on the Chobok girls' stories and how the public react to it both in the UK and in Nigeria, and most importantly, should we do more to rescue these girls?

The passion behind staging OLU comes from an overwhelming plight of wanting to bring awareness to the 219 Chibok schoolgirls that were abducted in 2014 by the terrorist group Boko Haram, they are yet to be found and returned to their families.


About Letters to CentreStage...

Letters To CentreStage is a brand new theatre company, dedicated to creating culturally relevant and exciting plays!

Ese Ighorae, who is of Nigerian descent, felt perplexed by the media attention that had all but disappeared and the girls were soon forgotten. Ese has worked as both a facilitator and an actress devising scripts with Peckham Baptist's young people working closely with them on their Junior Apprentice programme in collaboration with the Hebe Foundation to deliver workshops that engage young people in drama, public speaking and business enterprise. In 2015 OLU was shortlisted for the Verity Bargate award and made it to the final round. She is inspired by social change and believes that theatre can be used to inspire worldwide change.

As a Director/Facilitator Joss Lacey strives to encourage participants to be creative and confident so that they can be better performers and more self-sufficient as actors and as people. He allows actors to debate quite freely in rehearsals on the meaning of each line, their characters drive, and the themes around the play as a whole.

The Impact

We believe in the impact of this campaign ;

  • It will shine a light on the effects of human trafficking  putting pressure on those who participate.
  • It draws a universal awareness for the missing Chibok girls and reminds us of the importance of the girls story .
  • It introduces a wider variety of backgrounds to participate in a social campaign and allows them to actively stand with one another.
  • It  will create an increased sense of sensitivity to situations that don't directly effect us.


What we need...

We have budgeted £9000 for a tour around London and potentially all the way to the Edinburgh Fringe festival in August.

We have already raised £2600 thousand pounds, with more on the way, we will continue to raise more to reach this goal.

Every penny of your generous pledge will pay for rehearsal space, theatres to perform in, costume, set, travel expenses, marketing, accommodation and paying everyone involved in OLU's creation

All contributions will go towards performing OLU on a tour, even if we don't reach our full target, we will make sure we spend your contributions as effectively as possible to reach as many people as possible; even if this means reducing the number venues we can perform in.

Venue hire £490 x3

£1,470.00

Technician’s fee

£50.00

Travel expenses

£400.00

Costume and props

£160.00

Fliers

£100.00

Actors fee-£350x8

£2,800.00

Accommodation

£1,950.00

Rehearsal venues

£800.00

Director's fee

£390.00

Producer's fee

£400.00

Set driver

£290.00

Edinburgh Fringe registration fee

£204.00

Edinburgh Fringe Venue Hire

£700.00

Total

£9,014.00

Further breakdown:

  • £160 is our total budget we've allowed for our minimal costume and set

  • The Fliers are being designed and printed for us for free by Reroots designs

  • We will endeavour to make use of free rehearsal spaces where possible

  • We will endeavour to make use of free rehearsal spaces where possible

  • Rehearsal venue budget calculated having 16 rehearsals at £50 each half day

Our unique perks

We have offered perks for those of you generous enough to pledge, these include free tickets, Q&A with the cast and crew and other exciting OLU merchandise.

We would like to add that we are open to suggestions as well, if you feel you would prefer a different perk, please don't hesitate to get in contact an we'll see what we can do!

The bigger picture

Our long term aim is to draw young theatre makers into theatre encouraging them to help promote and take pride in their different cultural perspectives as well as their unique British perspective; and therefore change wider perceptions on what it means to be British. Any prospective tour for us would therefore be designed with workshops and outreach programs at its core, tackling the key themes of the play; focusing on Women's rights, schools with higher asylum seekers, bullying and violence against young girls.

The aim is for this show to bring new audiences to the theatre by combining spoken word, political theatre, comedy, and dialects that many British audiences haven't experienced yet but see similarities and experiences that ring true for both Britons and Africans.

Olu specifically aims to open dialogue on how we perceive one another, An awareness of violence against young girls and women at home and abroad. With Olu's story we aspire to reach audiences and for them to identify with Olu as someone that could be them, the fear of the unknown, making new friends, encouraging the audience to question their reactions to unfamiliar cultures, all whilst learning things about one another.

Finally with the play and the company as a whole, we aim to help sustain Black Asian, minority ethnic (BAME) artists in London. Olu being the first of many plays produced by Letters To CentreStage, OLU fulfils the need and want to hear the voices of diverse individuals in order to reflect the changing demographic of todays society. We aim to dispel the false archetypes that are currently portrayed in modern film, tv and theatre.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everybody is able to make a pledge but don't worry you can still support us...

Come to the show!

Be our audience!

And please share this opportunity with everyone you know!

£2,800.00




Accommodation


£1,950.00




Rehearsal
			venues


£800.00




Director's
			fee


£390.00




Producer's
			fee


£400.00




Set
			driver


£290.00




Edinburgh
			Fringe registration fee


£204.00




Edinburgh
			Fringe Venue Hire


£700.00




Total


£9,014.00





Further
breakdown:




	£160
	is our total budget we've allowed for our minimal costume and set



	The
	Fliers are being designed and printed for us for free by Reroots
	designs



	We
	will endeavour to make use of free rehearsal spaces where possible



	We
	will endeavour to make use of free rehearsal spaces where possible



	Rehearsal
	venue budget calculated having 16 rehearsals at £50 each half day



Our
unique perks


We
have offered perks for those of you generous enough to pledge, these
include free tickets, Q&A with the cast and crew and other
exciting OLU merchandise.

We
would like to add that we are open to suggestions as well, if you
feel you would prefer a different perk, please don't hesitate to get
in contact an we'll see what we can do!

The
bigger picture


Our
long term aim is to draw young theatre makers into theatre
encouraging them to help promote and take pride in their different cultural perspectives as
well as their unique British perspective; and therefore change wider
perceptions on what it means to be British. Any prospective tour for us would therefore be designed with workshops and outreach programs at
its core, tackling the key themes of the play; focusing on Women's
rights, schools with higher asylum seekers, bullying and violence
against young girls.

The
aim is for this show to bring new audiences to the theatre by
combining spoken word, political theatre, comedy, and dialects that
many British audiences haven't experienced yet but see similarities
and experiences that ring true for both Britons and Africans.

Olu
specifically aims to open dialogue on how we perceive one another, An
awareness of violence against young girls and women at home and
abroad. With Olu's story we aspire to reach audiences and for them to
identify with Olu as someone that could be them, the fear of the
unknown, making new friends, encouraging the audience to question
their reactions to unfamiliar cultures, all whilst learning things
about one another.

Finally
with the play and the company as a whole, we aim to help sustain
Black Asian, minority ethnic (BAME) artists in London. Olu being the
first of many plays produced by Letters To CentreStage, OLU fulfils the
need and want to hear the voices of diverse individuals in order to
reflect the changing demographic of todays society. We aim to dispel
the false archetypes that are currently portrayed in modern film, tv and
theatre.



Other
Ways You Can Help


We
know not everybody is able to make a pledge but don't worry you can
still support us...

Come
to the show!

Be
our audience!

And
please share this opportunity with everyone you know!

story:
"Fund the Furry" is our new Indiegogo campaign for the upcoming project "Dances for Intimate Spaces and Friendly People." A two-fold project produced and presented by the new Gibney Dance Center at 280 Broadway and taking place September 2nd to October 3rd. This project is structured as one week of performances (9/30-10/1-3) and a month-long installation at the new Center’s gallery that opens September 2nd. 

This project explores ways that dance making, dance, dancers, furries and spectators are impacted by different viewing perspectives. Conventional viewing of dance has been challenged since the 1960s when museums and galleries started presenting dance. The proximity of studio viewing of intricate physical relationships offered by this project challenges illusions of idealized bodies produced by the proscenium stage. Continuing the investigation between viewing and viewed, this project’s multiple facets (individual and simultaneous studio installation; group experience; Furry as interlocutor/curator, gallery exhibit) re-frame questions of perspective, location, presence, and the politics of bodies in performance within the context of contemporary culture. 

The performance component of Dances will be presented simultaneously in 4 individual studios with the audience sequentially rotating from studio to studio and experiencing one individual dance vignette at a time. As the evening’s culmination, each installation’s highlighted episodes will be simultaneously displayed side by side at the Center’s larger studio C. This finale is conceived as an antidote to the isolated studio viewing experience, offering viewers the experience of witnessing up close previously set studio material, through a structured improvisation score, merged with other studio material which will transform into new performances. 

Designed by video artist Peter Richards, the exhibit that accompanies the performance component, presents a visual record produced during the DIP residency, contextualizing the involved artists’ process in relationship to post/modern dance history. The exhibit and its accompanying catalogue call into question the art museum’s framing of people, bodies, furries, and dance as valuable art objects and instead propose a return to the personal  as political. This exhibit will be opened to the public during the day from September 2nd to October 3rd at the Center’s gallery.

story:
Insanity is a theater play, inspired by real events that occurred in the city of La Plata (Argentina) in 2013. It’s the story of the kidnapping, rape and violence against a woman by her boyfriend for an entire week.

Our play reflects the difficult situation that many women live subjected by their husbands, boyfriends or lovers.

-----------------

Insanía es una obra de teatro, inspirada en hechos reales sucedidos en la ciudad de La Plata (Argentina) en 2013. Es la historia del secuestro, maltrato y vejaciones a una mujer sometida durante una semana por su pareja. 

La obra refleja la difícil situación que viven miles de mujeres sometidas por sus esposos, novios o amantes.

THE STORY

In 2013, a woman decides to end the relationship with her partner due to his violent behavior. Given her decision, he kidnaps her for a week. And repeats every day the same violent ritual: he drugs her, rapes her, bathes her, dresses her up and put make up on her. She becomes his doll, an object that he shared with friends.

From this story, we build up a fictional universe in which the characters are trapped by a society that does not usually listen to women.

-----------------

LA HISTORIA*

En 2013, una mujer decide terminar con su pareja por sus actitudes violentas. Ante su decisión, él decide secuestrarla durante una semana, la mantiene drogada, la viola, la baña, la viste y la maquilla cada día. La convierte en una muñeca, un objeto que no solo usa sino que comparte con amigos. 

A partir de esta historia se construye un universo de ficción en el que los personajes están atrapados por una sociedad que no suele escuchar a las mujeres.

*Para proteger la identidad de los protagonistas. En nuestra obra no se mencionan nombres.

WHY HELP US?

We want you to support our project because we want to speak out, so viewers can feel for a moment the situation of these brave women who are trapped in a violent relationship.

-----------------

¿POR QUE AYUDARNOS?

Queremos que apoyes nuestro proyecto que va más allá de la obra de teatro, queremos alzar la voz, que los espectadores puedan sentir por un momento la situación de estas valientes mujeres que están atrapadas en una relación violenta.

WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN?

You can choose any of the rewards and claim your public recognition, get a beautiful book with the script of the play, photographic material of our essays, texts and drawings. Also you can get a DVD with the recording of our play and original music by SuBa (Italian-Argentine duo that plays acoustic music live during our performances).

-----------------

¿QUE OBTENDRÁS A CAMBIO?

Puedes elegir alguno de las recompensas y reclamar un reconocimiento  público, llevarte un hermoso libro con el guión de la obra, material fotográfico de ensayos, textos y dibujos. También podés tener el DVD con la grabación de la obra y la música original.

WHAT WE WILL USE THE MONEY FOR?

We want to meet our goal in order to make a play with all the elements we need: costumes, makeup, lights and sound. But we also want to print a booklet with helpful information on gender violence. This book will be deliver for free to our audience at the end of each performance.

-----------------

¿PARA QUE USAREMOS EL DINERO?

Queremos cumplir nuestra meta para poder hacer una obra con todos los elementos que necesitamos: Vestuario, maquillaje, luces, sonido. Pero también queremos imprimir un pequeño libro con información de ayuda sobre violencia de género,  que será entregado a cada uno de los asistentes al final de la obra.

WHO ARE WE?

We are a group of actresses, actors, producers, designers and technicians who understand that the theater, besides being a show is also a great opportunity to transmit strong messages about the conflicts of our society. In this case, we want to help raise awareness about the terrible scourge of gender violence.

-----------------

¿QUIENES SOMOS?

Somos un grupo de actores, actrices, productores, diseñadores y técnicos que entendemos que el teatro además de un espectáculo es una oportunidad para transmitir fuertes mensajes sobre los conflictos de nuestra sociedad.

CAST


Zuleika Esnal, Ariel Nuñez, Silvia Trawier, Andres Pabon Koch, Sol Lopez Gaschetto, Juan Palacios, Rodrigo Canepa, Matías Garnica, Johana Chiefo, Daisy Ruibarbo, Esteban Recagno and Carolina Luaces.

-----------------

ELENCO

Ariel Nuñez, Zuleika Esnal, Silvia Trawier, Andres Pabon Koch, Sol Lopez Gaschetto, Juan Palacios, Rodrigo Canepa, Matías Garnica, Johana Chiefo, Daisy Ruibarbo, Esteban Recagno, Carolina Luaces.

story:
Lone Wolf Tribe’s last fundraiser was in 2013 which allowed the premieres of The God Projekt and Hobo Grunt Cycle. 

Two years later we again are raising funds for two important creative projects: performing at the 30th anniversary convention for Veterans for Peace in California, and redeveloping The God Projekt through an artistic residency at NACL Theatre in upstate NY.

LONE WOLF TRIBE is...

A multi-disciplinary performance company based in Brooklyn, New York, helmed by founding artistic director, Kevin Augustine.

Blending history, philosophy and life-sized puppetry, LWT’s mission is to investigate, challenge and spellbind with fearless original stories that speak compassionately to our collective human experience.

WE ARE RAISING MONEY TO...

Fly Kevin to San Diego to perform at the National Convention of Veterans for Peace in August AND to fund our “Deep Space” artistic residency in September to redevelop The God Project, awarded through NACL Theatre in upstate NY.

The Projects:

Clarion Call

August 5th - 9th, 2015 in San Diego / Keynote Speaker: Seymour Hersh  

Invited by Veterans for Peace to bring our street-based peace pantomime to their 30th anniversary convention, we are honored to partner with a national organization working tirelessly to spread a message of non-violence both home and abroad. Sharing this performance series on the sidewalks of NYC since 2012, we're thrilled to now travel to California with our silent message of healing and transformation.

Clarion Call blends the weary, tattered hobo with the forgotten, homeless veteran to poetically subvert military iconography and routines into acts of love and compassion. This will mark the debut of Kevin’s commitment to an “endurance performance art” style—as he will stay in “Hobo Grunt” character throughout the entire 4 days of the convention.

The God Projekt

September 21st - 27th, 2015 - NACL Theatre / DEEP SPACE residency

Winner of the 2014 Innovative Theatre Award for OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE ART PRODUCTION and hailed “Astonishing” & “Genius“ by Time Out NY, The God Projekt has been invited by La MaMa’s artistic director, Mia Yoo for a 2016 return engagement! We are thrilled for this second opportunity to present this “startlingly intense” work about the secret history of God, with its hopeful message for new beginnings.

With a 7-day residency to rework the script and present 2 work-in-progress showings, we need this time at NACL to take our production to its next artistic level. 

THE REASON WE NEED YOUR HELP...

Although invited by both NACL Theatre and Veterans for Peace to perform our work for the public, neither organization can provide a budget that will cover our expenses. This includes travel (both flight and van), food & lodging expenses as well as artistic fees for our 5-person team working on The God Projekt.

LONE WOLF TRIBE'S IMPACT...

Since 1997, we've been creating theatrical work with impeccable artistic standards while exploring social justice issues impacting our world today.  Combining the power of puppetry with an empathetic consciousness for our collective experience, we hope to ‘contribute a verse’ towards making our world a better place. Please help LWT continue to create, produce and share this work!!

DOLLARS AND CENTS...

The specific funds we will raise will go to:

CLARION CALL : $950 = round trip ground travel + airfare (including all oversized baggage {puppet} fees) to San Diego; food (hotel room is being subsidized by VFP!)

The God Projekt : $3350 = round trip rental van to upstate NY +  artisitc fees and per- diems for 5 people for 7 days 

Please help us with any amount you can!

From the bottom of our hearts, we are grateful for your support.

THANK YOU!!!

Kevin Augustine - Artistic Director / Gloria Sun - General Manager

story:
ABOUT US

Wide Eyed Productions exists to bring brave, bold and culturally relevant new texts to production. With a core ensemble of emerging theatre artists, we are dedicated to leaving our audience Wide Eyed.

This year will mark Wide Eyed Productions’ eighth anniversary, and we have an awesome Summer Season of Fun planned for NYC. Not only are we continuing to produce our WINKS Staged Reading Series, which showcases three emerging playwrights once a month, we also have two amazing shows featured in the Samuel French OOB Festival 2015, and are in pre-production for our first webseries.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Clearly we know how to have “fun”!...but all this fun comes with a price. The nature of the festival, web series and reading series is that they are not designed to make revenue. Instead they are platforms for Wide Eyed Productions to be brave and bold and to work with new and amazing artists.

Although these are not revenue generating, there are costs ($3200) to having all this fun. Theater is always expensive to produce, especially for nonprofits, and we need your help to ensure that not only WE have a great summer, but that YOU have a great summer.  What is in it for you…besides great theater? Check it out on the right.

THE IMPACT

Wide Eyed has been producing prolifically since 2007 and officially incorporated as a 501(c)(3) non-profit in 2013. We have produced many shows in many theatres throughout the years, and are proud to be a part of the vibrant NYC indie theatre community. From our very first production of The Medea, to the quirky tale of A Devil Inside, to the classic One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest, and to the numerous new works from up-and-coming playwrights that have graced our stages, our shows speak for themselves. We continue to look forward to serving the NYC community and continue to generate exciting, thought-provoking theatrical works.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

When entering into any production, whether for one show or for an entire Summer Season of Fun, there will always be risks. Luckily, Wide Eyed Productions has a strong Board of Directors and a talented core ensemble that continues to rise to the occasion. In the last two years, we have made the conscious effort, spear-headed by our Board, to scale back our seasons and focus upon the business side of production. Our finances have never looked quite so promising as they do now, but we realize that in order for us to continue to operate in the black, we need to raise some green.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t make a donation today, we hope you stay in touch! We are always looking for volunteers!

www.wideeyedproductions.com

story:
Witness the Beginning is an immersive experience that examines humanity in its purest form. 

Our production viscerally surrounds the spectator with the breath of a world at the dawn of human civilization. The audience is invited to take part in the culture and customs of a re-imagined human tribe and explore the tribe’s relationship with the ecosystem they inhabit. We hope that Witness the Beginning will inspire others to reconsider our place in and relationship with Mother Earth. 


Who are we?

Team
Director.......................................................Drew Weinstein
Producer............................................................Greg Carter
Producer.........................................................Ashton Muniz
Associate Producer.........................................Katy Newton
Casting Director..........................................Hannah Richter
Production Designer..........................................Anna Grigo
Lighting Designer.......................................Jessica Creagar
Composer...........................................................Ben Kutner                           Voice/Speech Coach…….............................Thomas Rene Videographer…...........................................Joe Pietropaolo                                       Graphic Designer…...........................................Hayley Fox


Ensemble 
Kristen Dawn-Dumas
Carl Hsu
Natalia Lopresti
Eiko Kawashima
Ashton Muniz
Joe Pietropaolo
Alex Seife
Irina Varina
Melanie Ward


Why does it matter?

Witness the Beginning is a cultural call to arms that can influence the fate of life on planet earth. We as a creative team believe it is not enough just to create theatre that discusses the various issues plaguing our natural ecosystem. By creating an immersive experience, we’re taking a necessary step to help our audience viscerally understand humanity's effect on mother earth.

As a team, we’re building on a theatrical style that started with Conquest, an immersive experience that investigated the reasons for and often-violent effects of cultural misunderstanding. With Conquest, we succeeded in creating a performance that was riveting, inspiring, and thought provoking.

Witness the Beginning is our way of responding to the most pressing issue facing the modern world. Only by understanding humanity in its purest form can we as artists ask: How and why do humans destroy our natural environment, even when it prevents our chances of long-term survival?

In addition, by supporting Witness the Beginning, you are doing more than just helping us mount one production. Your support for Witness the Beginning is an important first step in the creation of a new artistic collective committed to bringing high quality, exciting, and socially relevant artistic experiences to life.

But we can’t do this without you! Even a $5 contribution will help us bring this essential production to New York and will help our collective hit the ground running.


We need your help!

Your contribution will help us create the project of our dreams by helping us pay for performance space, rehearsal space, costumes, set, lights, and marketing. Raising money through Indiegogo allows us to give all of our ticket sales right back to the artists involved in the project!

For more information, check out this breakdown of our budget:

We're also offering some exciting and unique perks for the project. These include: a personalized thank you note, an invitation to one of our rehearsals, an opportunity to actually take part in a rehearsal, and additional insight into the production!

Risks & Challenges

We recognize that this is an incredibly ambitious project for such a young theatre collective, but we believe that Witness the Beginning needs to be seen. Some of the major challenges we have faced along the way include finding affordable rehearsal space, finding the perfect performance venue, and selecting a nine person cast from the incredibly talented pool of actors New York has to offer. 

And this is only the beginning, the rehearsal process for this project is a major artistic risk. It is up to our cast and crew to create a fully functional tribe of people complete with their own physical vocabulary, values, language, and belief systems in only a few short weeks.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help us out by spreading the word! Like us on Facebook, visit our website, or post our campaign on your social media profile! Help us make noise so that we can bring this exciting project to life. Best of all, you can come check out the show the evening of October 10th!
story_txt:
Witness the Beginning is an immersive experience that examines humanity in its purest form. 
Our production viscerally surrounds the spectator with the breath of a world at the dawn of human civilization. 

The
audience is invited to take part in the culture and customs of a re-imagined
human tribe and explore the tribe’s relationship with the ecosystem
they inhabit. We hope that Witness the Beginning will inspire others to reconsider our place in and relationship with Mother Earth. 


Who are we?
TeamDirector.......................................................Drew WeinsteinProducer............................................................Greg CarterProducer.........................................................Ashton MunizAssociate Producer.........................................Katy NewtonCasting Director..........................................Hannah RichterProduction Designer..........................................Anna GrigoLighting Designer.......................................Jessica CreagarComposer...........................................................Ben Kutner                           Voice/Speech Coach…….............................Thomas Rene Videographer…...........................................Joe Pietropaolo                                       Graphic Designer…...........................................Hayley Fox

Ensemble Kristen Dawn-DumasCarl HsuNatalia LoprestiEiko KawashimaAshton MunizJoe PietropaoloAlex SeifeIrina VarinaMelanie Ward


Why does it matter?

Witness the Beginning is a cultural call to arms that can influence the fate of life on planet earth. We as a creative team believe it is not enough just to create theatre that discusses the various issues plaguing our natural ecosystem. By creating an immersive experience, we’re taking a necessary step to help our audience viscerally understand humanity's effect on mother earth.
As a team, we’re building on a theatrical style that started with Conquest, an immersive experience that investigated the reasons for and often-violent effects of cultural misunderstanding. With Conquest, we succeeded in creating a performance that was riveting, inspiring, and thought provoking.
Witness the Beginning is our way of responding to the most pressing issue facing the modern world. Only by understanding humanity in its purest form can we as artists ask: How and why do humans destroy our natural environment, even when it prevents our chances of long-term survival?
In addition, by supporting Witness the Beginning, you are doing more than just helping us mount one production. Your support for Witness the Beginning is an important first step in the creation of a new artistic collective committed to bringing high quality, exciting, and socially relevant artistic experiences to life. 
But we can’t do this without you! Even a $5 contribution will help us bring this essential production to New York and will help our collective hit the ground running.


   We need your help! Your contribution will help us create the project of our dreams by helping us pay for performance space, rehearsal space, costumes, set, lights, and marketing. Raising money through Indiegogo allows us to give all of our ticket sales right back to the artists involved in the project!
For more information, check out this breakdown of our budget:

We're also offering some exciting and unique perks for the project. These include: a personalized thank you note, an invitation to one of our rehearsals, an opportunity to actually take part in a rehearsal, and additional insight into the production!

    Risks & Challenges We recognize that this is an incredibly ambitious project for such a young theatre collective, but we believe that Witness the Beginning needs to be seen. Some of the major challenges we have faced along the way include finding affordable rehearsal space, finding the perfect performance venue, and selecting a nine person cast from the incredibly talented pool of actors New York has to offer. 
And this is only the beginning, the rehearsal process for this project is a major artistic risk. It is up to our cast and crew to create a fully functional tribe of people complete with their own physical vocabulary, values, language, and belief systems in only a few short weeks.

Other Ways You Can Help
 Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help us out by spreading the word! Like us on Facebook, visit our website, or post our campaign on your social media profile! Help us make noise so that we can bring this exciting project to life. Best of all, you can come check out the show the evening of October 10th!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Wilfried Souly, but everyone calls me Willy. I am a dancer and choreographer of contemporary and experimental African dance from Burkina Faso, living in LA. I’ve performed all over the world in my own work and the work of others.  I am on teaching faculty at UCLA World Arts and Culture and have a long-running community class at Your Neighborhood Dance Studio. I have been very fortunate to make my life through dance.  Now I am exploring how my identity, any identity is formed in arriving, in achieving, in becoming. And I am doing it at the NOW Festival on August 4. I’m asking for your help in raising $5000 to cover the costs of lightening programmer, live musical accompaniment, and salary for the dancers to augment the honorarium provided by REDCAT.

I am honored to have the opportunity to present at the NOW Festival at REDCAT for a third time. This is not an occurrence afforded to many artists in Los Angeles. I am devoted to bringing something new, unusual and intriguing. This piece is a new departure, officially launching my dance company, Souly Dance Arts. I want it to be both beautiful and compelling in all aspects.

Rehearsals are well underway. I am having a great time with Aaron Mason, Abagail Fritz, Sheena Young, Yu Sugisaka in the studio. We are looking forward to adding in our musicians, Julio Montero and Thomas Moose. Boubacar Djiga is headed to a recording studio in Burkina to record special music and sound for our soundscape. Things are coming together!

 Lighting is a crucial element of this new work. Carol McDowell has agreed to once again design the lights for my show. I am very lucky! I have already earned the support of LIFX, a company that produces light bulbs that can be controlled by your mobile phone. They donated 24 of the Color 1000 bulbs to perform alongside the dancers and musicians! Now, I need to hire a developer to work with the bulbs and Carol to design a score for the lights in the way I envision.

It takes a team to make brilliant work. I’m focused on delivering just that. This is where you come in.

What We Need & What You Get

I need a total of $7000 to cover costuming, dancer salary for 5 performers, lighting designer flat fee, developer flat fee for LIFX custom app, runs to Home Depot to buy materials for rigs for LIFX bulbs, fee for drummers, flat fee for set designer to construct interactive rigs for bulbs. I am asking you to help me with $5,000 of that.

Here’s the break down of what your contribution will cover:

Smart Light app $ 300.00

Costumes $ 375.00

Set $ 325.00

Artists salary $ 4,000.00

Total : = $5000

If I do not meet my goal, the show will go on. We already have the bulbs in hand and can make use of the native app that comes with them. Fundraising will continue to offset my out-of-pocket expenses because I will just dance harder to cover what I need. 

Should I be so fortunate as to go OVER my goal, I will pay a professional  video editor to work on the footage that REDCAT will provide…and maybe I will even pay myself…

 

What You Get

I am a big believer in being present, in showing up and sweating together. My perks are few, but mighty! I have a custom designed silk-screened t-shirt with my new company’s logo available in black with a gold image. These are limited edition; there are only 100 of them. The T-shirt will become your ticket to some other cool perks.  I hope you can identify with them.

 

The Impact

Too often, we independent choreographers ask dancers to work with us for little to no rehearsal pay, and then a small fee each night of the performance. Your support of this campaign will help me begin my company on the right foot, paying my dancers, musicians and team members. Up to now, I have done this out of my own pocket. Helping me cover these costs is an investment in dance arts and education in Los Angeles: the money given to the dancers will in turn support other artists and their communities. This is how we roll, as people say here in the US!

Your support will also help me create a new medium of exploration for my students at UCLA: the LIFX bulbs will become part of the instructional tools at World Arts and Cultures. The rigs and apps built for the piece will continue to be used to experiment with contemporary expressions of culture on the western coast of the continent of Africa. This is personally very exciting for me.

I would like to signal “experimental” with more than a combination of modern dance and traditional Manding dance from Burkina. Can the light sculpt the rhythm or vice versa? Can the app demonstrate and celebrate cultural differences? My “Africa” lives in many moments, in many countries, across many different types of bodies doing a vast number of things, moving in and out of shadow and sound. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is getting the app developed too late for us to truly employ the lights in the manner I am choreographing them. Yes, they are dancers, too! I already have a developer working on existing apps int he LIFX developer’s community platform, but putting together those commands with my own is the one big concern I have. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, but are good with your hands, we may need some help putting the final touches on the rigs! Things are moving quickly and I would love to focus just on the choreography. Be in touch!

Spread the word far and wide! This is just the beginning of Souly Dance Arts. Tell your friends on Facebook and Twitter to support this campaign. Good things are ahead.

Please support this work. It’s at great adventure, and one that will be seen very soon!  I look forward to dancing with you at the master jam!
